One thousand lies est un jeux magnifique, bien écris et avec un style de dessin agréable et beau ainsi qu'une bande sonore envoutante. Vous allez être emportés par l'histoire ainsi que vous aller vous attachez au personnage qui on chacun une personalité diférente et bien développé au courant de l'histoire. Il est sûr et certain que vous aller être interpellé par cette belle histoire de confiance en sois, d'amour,d'amitié et de passé. Si comme moi vous avez de la difficulté  a oublier votre passé, et bien cette histoire est pour vous, sinon vous pouver toujours esseiller se mangnifique ''novel'' qui serra vous toucher d'une manière ou d'un autre j'en suis certain. Sur ce  je vous souhaite une bonne lecture et bonne aventure. 

Parcontre, je dois malheureusement dire que la fin est longue, incompréenssible et décevante. Ce qui rend le tout très confue.

Engish version

One thousand lies is a beautiful game, well written and with a nice and beautiful drawing style 
as well as a captivating soundtrack. If like me you have difficulty to forget your past, well this story is for you, otherwise you can always try this magnificent  novel  that will affect you in one way or another I'm sure . On this, I wish you a beautiful reading and a great adventure.

On the other hand, I must unfortunately say that the end is long, incomprehensible and disappointing. Which makes everything very confusing.

40614337.review:
First off I'd like to say this:

Even If you have never played a visual novel before, this is a great one. It's a gem, for real. It's super philosophical, and deep. It's textbook visual novel in the sense that there are no options to change the story, it simply brings you along for the ride. Tbh, while that may irk some people, it did help to keep the immersion in the story. There are so many layers and elements to this story that may seem confusing at first, but as you continue along on your journey through the plotlines, it becomes ever clearer. It has it's moments of comedic content among the somber lucid seriousness, which can cut what might be tedious and boring and creating it into something far more intriguing. It's exceedingly well-written, more than some actual novels written nowadays, and tbh, it's now the best story I've seen come out of ren'py so far. Not to say there aren't great ones, it's just simply that this story took something easily used and made it into something grand. Now, I won't spoil the plot or anything by going into too much detail on the story or theorize anything here, I will say that you should experience this story for yourself. It's about an eight hour ride, so hold on to your hats.

SPOILER ALERT: I tried to keep from spilling too much, but these character reviews make more sense after you've read the story.


Now about the characters:

Ciaran is a contrtadictory creature. He says one thing and ultimately feels another. He is textbook socially awkward guy who doesn't know how to deal with people lol. Everything he does is dripping with cynicism and sarcasm, but in reality, there's so much more to him than that. Every decision he makes is preplanned, and he doesn't do anything without an escape route in place, even when it seems like he's being impulsive. His main thoughts are everyone else around him, as he tries to discover himself and everyone else. He's not all he seems at first, just take my word for it.

Ziva is a popular girl who takes up interest in Ciaran, at first glance, who loves to use her efforts in the study of psychology to "fix" what she feels appears to be wrong with him. As this really seems kind of shallow at first before you fully encompass the entirety of the story, it really goes to show you that everything is not always as it seems. She does everything on her own, whether others will go along or not, and most of her efforts seem to be geared toward her need for perfection in life. Is that true or not, is really up to the reader and the author themselves. In my opinion, humbly, I feel that love will often make anyone do anything if it's strong enough. We would wait forever for those we love, do anything to keep them by our sides, and even do anything in our power to help their situations, if that's the need for it. Is that the best course of action? Not always. Sometimes, we should simply take ourselves from the equation, and simply be happy for them without self involvement. Idk. That's my opinion, and I'm sticking to it. I do think she handled everything in the only way she knew how, and I don't know if I could stand by and be helpless, myself, if it were me.

Ausse is a character. He seems to be kind of narcissistic and full of himself, but I really don't think that is the true case for him at all. He purports a facade of himself that  he wants to become, so that he can basically "Fake it till he makes it" so to speak. He's rich, kind of a perv, and likes to have fun. He was originally a world traveling transfer, so in this new school, I guess maybe he saw he could become anything, and so he tried to do exactly that. In any case, any scene with him ends up hilariously exaggerated, and I'd have it no other way.

Claire is probably the closest character I myself could relate to. She's moody, mysterious, and all around an oddball. She seems to know everything about everything, and she has no qualms about doing whatever she needs to to do so. Considering this leads to some wacky adventures in the process, and some kind of awkward revelations, I think she could have been a little less weird about it, but nonetheless, my Slytherin qualities salute her. Theories surround this character, and most are probably correct. Do I wish they weren't? Yes, but it still works out, nonetheless. I guess. lol.

Luce, ah Luce. I love this character, and also dislike her, because she gets the prize in the end, so to speak. In the real truth, this is usually how it works, and though I love this story, I wish the story that should have been true were. In the end, the moon really usually does lose to the sun, and the reflections are merely that, and so I guess my qualms are more with that idea than the character herself. This artsy and sporty girl is thrown about in life by her own expectations, and has to force herself, with other's help, to make the decisions in her life and to help hold her accountable. While, I myself, can attest to...you know....same, but I digress, I really think she had a great influence on the main character, as you see his writings flourish and finally come to a sense of an end, something he was purely incapable of before. She's good for him in many senses, and succeeds where others fail in some ways.

All in all, amazing story. 13/10 will read again to try and distinguish more plot bunnies.

40549368.review:
One Thousand Lies ha sido una novela fantástica, me ha gustado todo. Tanto es así, que se ha convertido en mi novela favorita. De hecho la he acabado por tercera vez ya. ¿Por qué es una novela fantástica?
La historia de la novela está muy bien desarrollada, tiene un ritmo muy dinámico y animado, Intercalando reflexiones filosóficas muy interesantes, con situaciones completamente surrealistas y divertidas. Hay momentos para pensar, otros desternillantes, otros para llorar,... Es una montaña rusa de emociones. Escenas en las que no puedes parar de reírte y otras que te sacan la lagrimita, por alegría o por tristeza.  Engancha mucho, aunque su comienzo sea un poco caótico, luego ves que todo tiene sentido, tan solo hay que ser paciente para poder disfrutarlo.
Además, la forma de escribir del autor es muy rica en lenguaje, que embellece mucho la obra. Esto se debe a que el autor es español, está escrito en su lengua original y no es una simple traducción (además del dominio que el autor tiene, si lo comparamos con otras novelas juveniles).

Un punto muy importante sobre el contenido filosófico de esta novela es que no requiere ningún tipo de base previa. No cita a grandes autores, los pocos nombres propios del mundo real se utilizan como ejemplo o información auxilar. Esto es algo que hace a la obra mucho mejor para un público general: te habla sobre reflexiones que podría tener cualquier adolescente o adulto joven con un poco de madurez. Y es muy posible que te sientas identificado con la forma de pensar de algún personaje.

Y hablando de personajes,¿cómo son estos? Muy buenos. Se desarrollan muy bien en la corta duración de la novela, algunos son más planos que otros pero todos ocupan un rol importante en la historia. Puedes ver bien qué piensan o a qué aspiran estos. Sus interacciones con el protagonista nos dan mucha información sobre él, y algunas conversaciones son dignas de enmarcar.

En el aspecto visual, es todo bastante correcto. Los sprites de los personajes son bonitos y expresivos. Sin embargo, hubiese estado mejor si tuviesen más posiciones corporales, que algunas veces te podían sacar del momento. La falta de sprites se debe a recortes de presupuesto, que siendo una obra gratuita, resulta comprensible. Los fondos son fotografías con un filtro con el que parecen dibujos. A mí personalmente eso me gusta. Si hubiese que tachar algo de este apartado, sería las pocas ilustraciones que hay en toda la novela. Otra vez, se perdona porque se entiende que es por la falta de presupuesto. Pero ese resquemor se queda ahí.

Y en el apartado de banda sonora... qué decir. Es magnífica. Las piezas suenan acorde a la situación, y son de gran calidad, que seguramente quieras escuchar luego con tu reproductor de música (suerte que el DLC gratuito es esta banda sonora descargable).

En definitiva, una obra recomendable a todo el mundo, pero sobretodo a adolescentes y adultos jóvenes. El contenido es brillante y la forma de expresarlo bellísima. Ya estoy esperando la siguiente obra del autor.

39100761.review:
[h1] Obra maestra [/h1]

One Thousand Lies es una de las mejores, por no decir la mejor novela visual, que he visto y jugado. Si alguien tiene alguna duda de si el juego vale la pena, que se pasee un poco por los recomendados para ver las valoraciones de los demás usuarios. Yo intentaré analizarlo lo mejor posible y sin spoilers [spoiler] todos sabemos que los spoilers son malos [/spoiler]

[b] La historia [/b]

No me voy a ir por las ramas (porque puedo hacer spoiler, y dije que no lo iba a hacer). Ciarán Endyein recibe un extraño correo electrónico por una compra que hizo online. Desde ese momento, su vida cambia.


[b] Pros [/b]
[list]
 [*] Personajes entrañables, divertidos y, simplemente, geniales. De lo más divertido que te llamen [i] partner [/i]
 [*] Música perfecta para cada situación. La banda sonora se encuentra como DLC gratuito, por si alguien quiere ponerse en bucle la canción del menú principal o la pieza [i] Claire de Lune [/i] de Debussy
 [*] Apartado artístico maravilloso. El estilo anime de los personajes hace que la novela visual te inspire confianza (Claro, si te gusta el anime)
 [*] Historia preciosa. Me encantó la historia que se cuenta en OTL (acabo de ver que las siglas de One Thousand Lies es una persona arrodillada), un final genial que hizo que me saltasen las lágrimas, literalmente.
 [*] Referencias por doquier. Te llaman McFly y vas por la ciudad en una caja como Snake, ¿qué más se puede pedir?
 [*] Humor. No sé qué explicar de "humor", la verdad
[/list]


Si aún no habéis jugado a OTL, hacedlo, no os vais a arrepentir. Igual pensáis que se hace lento, o que es aburrido porque es una historia lineal, sin nigún tipo de interacción, pero os aseguro que merece la pena. 
De mis 12 horas, creo que 1 es de escuchar la canción del menú principal.

38615585.review:
[h1] Worth Playing! [/h1]
[b]Here's why...[/b]
[i](No Spoiler)[/i]

Let's start off with my first encounter with One Thousand Lies.
At first glance, I thought this game was a pretty short and simple VN, like any other. With it's not so great backgrounds, well for my taste that is. I immediately felt like it wasn't even worth playing, specially after seeing such few reviews. But still, I installed it, for the sake of recording it for the YouTube Channel. I thought, "Hey, maybe it's still worth recording", but I didn't... I opened the game, to check if everything's working properly. I read a bit of the start, to find out if it's worth continuing. In the end, I wasn't satisfied. I never bothered recording, instead I played it, since it's already installed...

About 30 mins in, I can feel myself sighing in regret. I can understand if the dev's are trying to make it philosophically deep, but at times, it get's pretty tedious to read. The fact that it's mostly just deep words with simple meaning. It made it less enjoyable. I ended up skimming some lines, mostly because they're just pointless to read, and a bit repetitive. But after time, I got used to it, just shrugging it off.

Hours already passed, i'm starting to enjoy it. The sense of humor and cliches kept me going, mostly the humor. I didn't expect much from the story, as it's the typical "Teen protag-kun undergoing a mysterious problem" scenario. There wasn't much to it, specially the fact that I've seen most of this kind of scenarios in anime... Then it hit me, the whole VN felt like an anime. One of those comdedic Slice of Life animes that ends up serious about mid season of the series. But the thing with One Thousand Lies, was the fact that it took so much time and compiled all the tension, executing it near end. In short, it felt rushed. It didn't have a proper flow...

I've reached the end... A bit overwhelmed, my brain connecting the pieces of the story, figuring out what the heck just happened. It all felt too much in a short span of time, guess they wanted to give a big impact on the players. Well, it worked. I felt satisfied reaching the end, a bit sad and still confused, so much questions unanswered.

...

Now, from what I've said so far, they all mostly sound negative. But don't let that decieve you. The game has it's quirks that makes it good in it's own way. One of such is the humor, in which I loved. It really felt like reading a Slice of Life anime, about teens doing stupid stuff. Another one are the characters, their personality makes them likeable and enjoyable to be around (specially Ausse). I may have not been able to relate with the Protagonist in a deeper level, nevertheless I was happy with it. It wasn't my story after all, it was his. Also, the story isn't that bad, nor too cliche. I'm not going to explain why, as I'd like to avoid any spoilers, and it's better for you to find out on your own. I'd ruin the fun if I told hints.

In the end of the day, it wasn't the best nor was the worst. It was good. I'd rate it 7.5/10 (.5 for the humor).

Esta novela visual me ha conseguido atrapar totalmente por cómo está relatada: Mantiene tensión, la libera, te sorprende con una broma, vuelve a hacerte pensar. Así una y otra vez, manteniéndote interesado en todo momento, y acompañando los sucesos de forma muy acertada con música bastante agradable.

Lo que más me ha gustado es que, al acabarla, mi cabeza no ha parado de dar vueltas, intentando atar cabos, descartando teorías que me había formado y empezando a entender muchas cosas que al principio parecían no tener sentido. No estoy segura de si he interpretado la historia tal y como el autor pretendía, pero, si esperaba hacer pensar al lector, lo ha conseguido del todo.

En definitiva: Con una calidad muy buena, dosis intensas de reflexión sobre relaciones sociales y la mente y con un humor absurdo y totalmente genial, la recomiendo totalmente. Y espero con ganas nuevos títulos de su autor.

38157085.review: This story had a lot more depth then I thought it did. I honestly wasn't interested in it in the beginning, but it was the little things that were out of place that kept me interested, and I'm glad I stuck around. "One Thousand Lies" is certainly more "heart-felt" than most visual novels I have read before, and it was really lovely to read. The art was nice, the music was alright, but the story went deeper than I thought it would. It's hard to explain, you should check it out for yourself.

38156040.review:
3 out of 5 ☆☆☆☆☆!

[h1]One Thousand Lies[/h1] -- How can anyone lie this much?
Ciaran is different. He feels like that doesn't really have a sense of belonging in this world. The girls he liked, he thinks they just play with his heart; that all the time they had together was just a lie. A lie. One thousand lies. His friend betryed him. He doesn't have anyone to confide in. He's just trying to find his purpose in life. Then he [spoiler]commits suicide[/spoiler]. But, [spoiler] THIS WAS ALL JUST A LIE ANYWAY. IT'S A PRANK[/spoiler]

[h1](´｡• ᵕ •｡`) ♡ -- What I Loved Best[/h1]
+ I could relate to Ciaran [I think I spelled his name right?]
+ He is a funny goofball

[h1]٩(｡•́‿•̀｡)۶ -- What Was Ohkay[/h1]
+ There are a lot of high vocabulary; they make you think about how the main character is really feeling
+ The beginning was a bit unecessary although it gave background information; still all the long paragraphs..
+ It takes a while to get to the main plot
+ His character develops slowly

[h1](⇀‸↼‶) -- What Could've Been Better[/h1]
+ You don't really understand in the beginning what exactly the titles means until the mid-end
+ Scenes are generic; more focused on the characters than the actual scenery
+ [spoiler]He's spends his time trying to hunt down the person who stole his anime figurine, but it turns out that was all a plan to get the girl he liked[/spoiler]

Overall, one easy achievent, just read through the whole gameplay and read the epilouge. It's free to play, so unless you're fussy about your stats on Steam, this VN should be lighthearted for you.

37509889.review:
One Thousand Lies trudno mi oceniać. Od początku miała według mnie wiele problemów. Największym z nich było przykucie mojej uwagi tak, żebym chciał kontynuować przy najbliższej okazji. Czytałem godzinę, żeby wrócić po trzech mięsiącach. Następnie godzinę i znowu długa przerwa. Potem cztery godziny i znowu odstawiłem czytanie na póżniej. Jedyne osiągnięcie za skończenie historii zdobyło jakieś 25%.

One thousand Lies nie ma wyborów. Historia wydaje się na siłę wydłużona. Ma kilkanaście niesamowitych moim zdaniem momentów, niektórych się w ogóle nie spodziewałem, ale przebijanie się do nich przez barierę dziesiątek, niezawsze ciekawych, dialogów potrafi poważnie zniechęcić.

Łącznie jest pięć rozdziałów. Po kilka pod rozdziałów i epilog. Mi przejście zajeło 9.6 godzin, a gdybym nie ominął trzech nieciekawych rozmów w ostatnim rozdziale przekroczyłbym i dziesięć.
Historia jest darmowa. Jeżeli nie przeszkadza ci, brak interaktywności lub MASA dialogów, a liczysz na ciekawą historie lub postacie. To je tu odnajdziesz. Ogólnie polecam. Muzyka jest przyjemna i może za dwa lata odświeże sobie część tej historii, ponieważ mnie osobiście chwilami dotknęła.

Nie jest to jednak historia, która zaciekawi każdego. Na początku mamy doczynienia z miłym i lekkim klimatem, ale końcówka jest zupełnie odmienna.

36467525.review:
Yeah, I can understand why this novel will receive some mixed reviews. It is however an intelligent piece of writing. It's also a grown up love story, yes, with some flaws, but serious and dramatic with a lot of hidden meanings and themes. 

Why do you need to check it out? Well, some hi-lites include: various secrets, the haunting piano and jazz soundtrack, some funny and deeply damaged characters with almost upronounceable names and surnames, strip poker and (a very questionable) joyride and a team death match with guns, in a school.

I don't think this was originally written in English, and it felt if some things were lost in translation. At some points there is no distinction between characters words and dialogue, as if they are speaking from the same mouth and similar. Also, perhaps due to the translation, the story does tend to carry on about insignificant story details in the search of making it an epic. However, hang in there, in the end it all gets tied together.

It took me just over 7 hours to complete, and yes, I would have loved some game choices to spruce things up, but as the story went on, I realised I should have rather played chapter to chapter, saved regularly, take a break, think about the game, come back later refreshed and take it all in again, slowly.

Pros - A novel of this high quality free, including dlc soundtrack, is unbeleivable. A lot of hard work went into this, and it shows. Great and easy to read in game menus. Magnificent backgrounds and animation. Also some nice music from the moonlight piano, to something reminding me a lot of Charles Schultz's 'Peanuts', I thorougly enjoyd the classic and sometimes jazzy, soundtrack. Some beautiful themes about life and endings, and pain. A story within a story.

Cons - I didn't like the start of the game, it felt wrong, however ride (or read) it out, it gets better. With novel games the font, size and color is extremely important to me, and this game has a lot of backgrounds with brownish colours, and the font background is translucent, this caused some problems for me. There are also quite a few loose ends in the story for example what was up with the policman/barman/waiter/spy character and why the racial overtone? No in game choices, it's a movie in other words, even if your choices where liniar and cosmetic, this would have been apreciated.

Prepare some popcorn, and watch this on autoplay, no choices needed just save when you get tired and come back later, it will take some time, but if you stick with it you'll find a lot of heart and some genuinely haunting themes. 7/10

36236055.review: (I may or may not be crying as i'm typing this). I'm in disbelief. this game was not as long as "If My Heart Had Wings(Aerodynamics: the Visual Novel)", or as advanced, yet it has overtaken it as my number one favorite. what this game lacks in graphically superior cutscenes, it excels in almost every other aspect. right off the back we get characters with compelling motives and personalities, as well as a relatable protagonist. the plot's premise was familiar and cliche but this game takes it and rewrites its entire goddamn existence and purpose. a group of high school seniors learn a LOT of valuable lessons and information about each other as graduation approaches(play to figure out their relationships, history, and dynamics for yourself, heh). a completely separate score accompanies each background and scenario to establish and differentiate themselves. chapters are a reasonable length and the plot flows smoothly. the humor relies on sarcasm, lack of seriousness and sincerity, and so many references(to the outside world and to itself), that you'd think Deadpool hijacked the script. it all culminates, resembling a more realistic take on something so common. the introduction isn't overflowing with pointless exposition, the middle was admittedly the most enjoyable and settles you comfortably into the novel, and the ending is climatic as fuck. the incorporation of inarguably the most important lesson as the novel's foundation(title gives you a very insubtle hint), makes a lot of fucking sense and left my mouth visibly opened by how drastically my view of the main characters changed. not to mention, unless you closely follow the story, the twist is HUUUUUGE, yet phenomenal. this visual novel didn't need to be flashy or overdeveloped to deliver. the amount of substance from this free-to-play game shocks me immensely. with as many meaningful games as i've played, i won't lie(wink wink), it was almost impossible to think that i could even determine a favorite. I've made so many connections, and have been exposed to so many concepts, methods, styles, etc. i think i can appreciate and continue to play these games, despite what happens to my emotional state. a little prematurely optimistic, especially after my last review was deserveably a negative one. hey, i dropped reading actual books for a reason, ok. who knew that all it took to reinvigorate my interest in reading was to combine it with my favorite passion. everyone has a reason for doing something, y'know?

36024400.review:
One Thousand Lies, è una deliziosa perla, un gioco che potenzialmente potrebbe essere apprezzabile sia dai cultori del genere, sia chi si approccia per la prima volta, tuttavia necessita di una buona conoscenza dell'inglese.

Per essere un gioco gratuito mi ha molto sorpreso, certamente, ci sono dei dettagli che non mi hanno fatto impazzire, ma tralasciando ciò ne ho apprezzato quasi tutte le caratteristiche.

Prime tra tutte, la narrazione e i personaggi. Non è una storia scontata, e difficilmente tende ad annoiarti: trovo che brilli particolarmente nelle sezioni comiche e quotidiane, ma non è da meno nemmeno in quelle serie in cui ti spinge a riflettere su modi di vedere il mondo e le considerazioni che si posson fare su di esso.
I personaggi sono estremamente apprezzabili, poiché non sono affatto stereotipati, perlomeno sebbene all'inizio possa dare tale impressione, con il tempo il gioco mostra una certa profondità di essi, soprattutto grazie alle relazioni che vi sono tra loro, anch'esse ben gestite (non tanto tra tutti i personaggi, ma mi riferisco principalmente al protagonista).

Infine, il comparto sonoro e il comparto grafico. Nel primo caso abbiamo una colonna sonora tanto semplice quanto piacevole, non da mai fastidio ed è appropriata nelle situazioni bene o male.
Il comparto grafico è la cosa che mi ha convinto di meno, non tanto gli scenari né i personaggi in sé, ma altri disegni che li ho trovati un po' bruttini.

Tirando le somme: Questa visual novel, non è delle più originali né delle più incredibili, ma nella sua semplicità ha una profondità da non sottovalutare, e i diversi aspetti che la compongono la rendono estremamente valida da molti punti di vista, consigliatissima a chiunque si voglia approcciare al genere e che mastichi l'inglese.

35250902.review:
Props on the art. It's excellent, professional really. But I would probably tell the game's developer to give up in the writing department immediately because after reading a few lines of cringey, emo, "I'm so deep and no one understands me, it's everyone's fault my life's a mess, adults are narrow-minded and naive" discourse I had to stop. I skipped through the first couple of screens because it was prose trying to be verse, trying to be some teenagers inflection of why their life, love and friendship was thrown out of wack. At first I thought it was manufactured, but became more and more convinced that it is really the writer's own inflections. Either way, theres a place for cringey teen's philosophy but not at the expense of a concrete story.

I would advise the writer to read out their writing and ask themselves if an outside reader could even understand what they're rambling on about? I know because I was an emotional wreck of a teenager once who poured his emotions onto the pages of a cringey novel he was writing.

Also I hate passive voice, it works occasionally but it stinks of amateur.

Don't write, go to art school, you will be a hit there!

34768404.review:
have mixed feelings about this one...

on one hand it felt like some scenes were too juvenile / silly / visual novel cliché / non realistic to really be of any interest. some of the non-sensical action scenes that come out of nowhere (just to keep the reader awake i guess) are good example of that. how the hell are teenagers not old enough to drive but can order whiskey at will btw?! then other scenes would get too philosophical without really making their meaning clear. so all of this just felt like too much reading for what i was getting out of the game, it made me consider dropping the game quite a few times. but i just ended up saving whenever i got bored or annoyed with the sillyness, and always ended up coming back after a few days to figure out what would happen next. so i guess the writing was doing something right after all?! or my completion OCD was acting up in this games favor.

all that being said, i was very happily surprised with the one hidden truth part, delivering a lot of sense to the actual plot beyond the clichè teen love story thing. i think without that part i would have down rated this game.

and at the end of the day, for a free to play game, it has more high quality content than quite a few absurdly expensive visual novels out there have. so i recommend it to fans of the visual novel game genre.

34442868.review:
rom Keinart Lobre comes One Thousand Lies, a free to play, visual anime game. Released in 2016, you follow the story of Ciaran Ednyein who lives a pretty simple life. One day, he gets a mysterious email and must find out who sent it, and send him on an adventure to learn about love and life.

I was recommended this by the Steam Store and it was apparently similar to other games I had played, like Trick and Treat and Elisa: The Innkeeper Prequel. I had enjoyed both of these games and decided to get this to give it a try and see what it was like. This was not like either of the games Steam said it was.

This is purely a book. There's no play features about it. You read the text and the speech and progress through the game purely to see what happens. I was bored within minutes. There's no choices, there's nothing for the player to actually do, other than skim the text.

Eventually, I just put autoskip on to complete the game and get the achievement because I didn't even care enough about the characters to even sit and read it all through, and sat writing reviews whilst the game completed itself. Ultimately, it took 12 minutes, and the Store page says it takes 5-10 hours? I think not.

I don't think that has anything substantial to hold itself as game. I'm surprised the rating for it is so high. Luckily, the achievement is easy enough to grab so if you want to collect another completed game, maybe just grab this and skip everything for the achievement. 

The achievement being easy is the only decent thing about this game.

34408135.review: Creo que es bastante lento al principio, tal vez deba darle una segunda portunidad a este juego D:

34215141.review:
First off: Keinhart Lobre, you're one of my favorite creators now.

I wrote this review as soon as I finished the VN. I think it's important to note that I'm not really into VNs especially if they're not that interactive, BUT, this one made me love the genre! 

The story was well written, I have to admit, I did predict most of what happened in the early parts of the story, but the ending - that caught me off guard. 

The artstyle looks great despite the repetitiveness of it; more variations and probably some simple, yet, sweet/fluid animations would be better. Oh, and maybe some voice overs, too? I believe that will add to the immersion and to the feelings that the texts tried to convey.

Overall, the soundtrack was great, the artstyle was fine, and the story, WOW, I can't stress how much I love that sweet twist!

Great job!

34159041.review:
Me gustaría hacerlo corto, ya que este título permite hablar de él de manera larga y tendida. Porque, una vez finalizada, no puedes dejar de atar cabos y desarrollar hipótesis (ya sean más o menos acertadas).

Sin duda una novela visual que merece la pena ser leída. No, más bien, pensada y reflexionada. Sin olvidar sus constantes toques cómicos gracias a la "perspectiva" del protagonista. En un segundo puede estar perdido en sus pensamientos y en el otro segundo contar cómo están robando un coche.

El mayor problema es conseguir pasar de la introducción. Al principio se me hizo un poco pesada, pero en el momento que te encariñas con los personajes y empiezas a observar el constante tira y afloja de momentos cómicos y serios, no te queda otra que continuar leyendo. Encima está en español, así que los hispanohablantes tienen aun menos excusa (junto a que es gratis, pero con un material de primera). La redacción es muy buena, por si fuese poco, y los fallos son imperceptibles practicamente.

Ausse, el amigo pervertido, junto a la parte cómica de Ziva y la personalidad del protagonista crean un trío cómico donde ya sabes que alguna locura van a hacer. Luce añade aun más salsa a la combinación, si bien brilla más en sus momentos competitivos con el prota. Y, bueno, Claire... Claire siempre estará ahí cuando haga falta zambullirse de lleno en los pensamientos más íntimos.

Recomiendo este título de veras, me alegra ver que haya gente hispanohablante que se mueva e interese por este tipo de obras.

34155537.review:
Che dire.

PESANTE.

Ma bello.

12 ore, sì, ed è anche molto lungo, ma c'è da fare una considerazione: non lo ritengo un gioco. Non lo è. A differenza di altre Visual Novel non c'è la benchè minima scelta, è semplicemente un libro illustrato. E anche abbastanza difficile da seguire, almeno per quanto riguarda la morale della storia.

Essenzialmente la storia va avanti tra le avventure di un gruppo di ragazzi che si avvicinano al loro ultimo giorno di scuola e considerazioni abbastanza pesanti di carattere psicologico che riguardano come si approccia una persona alla vita, alle sue scelte, alle sue decisioni, alle sue paure.

In alcuni momenti è estremamente divertente, grazie anche al protagonista principale che è un vulcano in piena di battute estremamente divertenti, ma anche ai suoi amici che dipingono siparietti da vera commedia.

Quando però la storia vira al lato psicologico magari risulta un pochino pesantuccio, a volte con tonnellate di testo che si susseguono, forse anche ridondanti. Però è piacevole.

Io ci ho messo sulle 12 ore, ma leggendo davvero con molta calma il tutto, quindi non baypassando velocemente i dialoghi.

Non è chiaro fino alla fine dove gli autori vogliono andare a parare, ma alla fine ritengo di esserne rimasto molto soddisfatto quando almeno si arriva ad una conclusione (con la storia del lupo anche molto commovente... per chi volesse andare fino in fondo).

Alla fine del gioco state attenti: c'è un'altra sezione da affrontare ed è quella che sblocca l'unico achievement.

Lo consiglio a chi vuole qualcosa da NON giocare (soprattutto con il caldo di questo periodo), a chi vuole leggere tanto in inglese, magari per esercitarsi, a chi vuole fare ogni tanto una risata, a chi non si annoia facilmente.

Non lo consiglio a chi cerca un videogioco.

Però è bello, ma non me la sento di mettere un voto numerico.

34128431.review:
One Thousand Lies ist eine Visual Novel (bzw. eine Kinetic Novel, denn Entscheidungsmöglichkeiten hat man keine) von Keinart Lobre.
Man schlüpft in die Rolle des Schülers Ciarán, der kurz vor dem Schulabschluss steht. Viel mehr möchte ich zur Handlung nicht verraten, nur noch soviel: Es ist im großen und ganzen eine Liebeskomödie. Es gibt eine Handvoll liebenswerter Charaktere die recht unterschiedlich sind und oft sinnlose, aber dafür meist lustige Gespräche führen. Nur manchmal wird es sehr tiefgründig, fast schon philosophisch. Da One Thousand Lies nur in englisch und spanisch zu lesen ist, sollte man eine der beiden Sprachen gut beherschen, sonst wird man in eben diesen Abschnitten Verständnisprobleme bekommen. 
Die Grafik fand ich sehr ansprechend, die Charaktere sind gut und einzigartig gestaltet und die Galeriebilder sind sehr hübsch anzusehen, auch wenn mir ein wenig die Liebe zum Detail fehlt. Die Hintergründe sehen so aus, als ob man ein Foto genommen und dieses dann verpixelt hat. Dadurch haben mich die HG´s nicht wirklich angesprochen aber ich fand es auch nicht sonderlich negativ.
Die Musik ist in meinen Augen, neben den lustigen Gesprächen, das I-Tüpfelchen des Spiels, auch wenn die Charaktere leider nicht vertont sind. Viele der Titel sind Klavierstücke die nicht nur sehr atmosphärisch, sondern klanglich auch sehr eindrucksvoll sind. Selbst wenn euch das Spiel also nicht interessiert könnte der kostenlose Soundtrack des Spieles ein Anreiz sein es sich mal runterzuladen.
One Thousand Lies ist in meinen Augen eine der besten VN´s, zumal sie auch noch komplett kostenlos ist. Ich konnte viel lachen und teilweise auch grübeln und vor allem hat sie mich nie gelangweilt. Jeder der ein passables englisch (oder spanisch) spricht und für VN´s auch nur ein wenig übrig hat kann sich dieses Spiel ruhig einmal genauer ansehen.

34080484.review:
看到现有的评测基本都是说这游戏拿成就很方便的，认真谈论游戏的人比较少，作为一个文本基本都过了一遍的选手感觉还是要评论一下。我之前看过的VN有《Eden*》《Lucy~eternity》《Highway Blossoms》等等。

[h1]游戏时间[/h1]
    作为一篇Visual novel，本作的文本量很大，我个人的游戏时间有点夸张，主要是前面认真地查字典和有时候把游戏开着人去干别的事情导致的，估计游戏时间（六级水平的话）在12h左右，英语好的话应该更短一些。

[h1]剧情[/h1]
+本作的剧情绝对是一大亮点。主线的剧情发展非常符合One Thousand Lies的标题，基本是千回百转，每次你都感觉自己找到了真相，但每次的真相都只是一部分的真相加上一些用于掩饰最后真相的谎言；从真相揭露的开始，文本开始进入高潮部分，然后一波接一波。全文以Lie为线索，逐渐逐渐揭开真相，是一个有关友情、爱情和自我救赎的故事。在大量的对话和心理描写中，每个人的性格都非常有特色，但是和一般二次元的角色不同的是，这些角色的情商都很高，并有属于他们自己的阴暗面，人物的塑造过程中虽然常常出现非现实的事件，但人物的性格都在往现实和复杂的方向靠。[strike]在虚拟作品中寻找现实感的我一定是脑子有问题。[/strike]
    
+不仅如此，主线剧情中包含的用于塑造和丰富人物形象并为结局埋下伏笔的小故事都很有趣甚至无厘头甚至非现实性很强，看起来是用于铺垫的日常，但是在阅读的过程中并不至于无聊。

+主线剧情之外看起来一头雾水的小故事都有特殊的隐喻和含义，在结局的时候会对它们有更深的理解。

+这部VN原先可能是西班牙语的，翻译成英文的时候依旧保证了相当高的文笔质量。（不过这也导致了常会出现一些西班牙语的词汇和重音等）

[u]从剧情和人物塑造的角度看，这部作品优秀于我之前看过的任何一部VN。虽然不是每一部作品都要讲一个道理，这个作品的主题其实是不明确的，它只是纯粹讲了一个故事，并且把这个故事叙述得很巧妙。[/u]


-最后结局的时候只有恍然大悟的感觉，感动的部分比较少。

[h1]立绘[/h1]
+立绘相当精致，人物画得很棒。（特别是对于一部免费作品来说）

-人物的表情和动态比较少。

 -CG的图相对立绘来说有点崩。

[h1]配乐[/h1]
	+配乐很令人舒心，基本也和剧情符合，用了许多古典音乐的曲子，不会频繁出现某一首。在音乐的界面点某个曲子会弹出来德彪西的Wiki界面2333

[h1]剧透[/h1]
[spoiler]这个故事告诉我们：萝莉是不存在的。Claire does NOT exist.[/spoiler]

33861442.review:
It's a free visual novel that takes 7-8 hours to read.

There are themes of drama, romance, humor, and philosophy. The story is told in the first person perspective and there are no branching paths or choices to make.

I felt that the artwork and music were well done. However, the actual story itself is not going to appeal to everyone, so I'll briefly cover the good and bad:

THE BAD:
On the surface it's a tale about some juvenile delinquents and their interpersonal relationships. The kids do quite a few illegal things (breaking and entering, constant truancy, carjacking, ect) but they are seldom caught, and even when they are caught they are seldom actually punished. 

This was a sore point for me because I was constantly thinking to myself, "If I had done that in high school I would have been expelled immediately!" In short, it hurt my suspension of disbelief and nearly caused me to give up reading the novel several times. This issue is actually addressed at the end of the novel, but I feel by that time any reader who had been wavering on this issue would have put the book down long ago.

Also, the novel starts slowly and takes a while to really get moving which was unfortunate.

THE GOOD
On the bright side the novel has some great character development. The characters are mostly interesting and they all grow and change over the course of the story. There are no superflous characters that clutter up the narrative which is a good thing. Some of the humor was pretty funny too.

I noticed no major spelling or grammar issues. 

Please note that the story is not actually done when you finish the final chapter. Instead there is an epilogue which can be accessed from the main screen. Completing the epilogue will award you the game's single Steam achievement. 

If you like visual novels this might be worth checking out!

33740628.review:
Oof... This game is one of these cases when I really wish there was a neutral recommendation button. I don't want to give the devs a negative one as they clearly devoted a lot of time and effort to deliver a well made final product, but at the same time I do want to say a few words about it and I cannot say I would personally recommend it.

What was my fault was, I didn't notice it was a kinetic novel while downloading it. I saw tons of good reviews and a "Visual Novel" tag - and, since it was free at the same time, that was all I needed to install the game. I'm a fan of making choices and influencing the story, and in case of kinetic novels, I'd much prefer if they were made into comics, or books/short written stories. A lot of the scenes seemed much too long for me, and, with the repetitive, unchanging backgrounds, it almost felt like a chore to read through them - but, since I started, I wanted to know what the ending will be.

As someone pointed out in another review, all of the story comes to a conclusion within the last minutes of the whole game - that's when it actually gets interesting - but the previous hours, they do feel pretty bland. It was all needed for the ending, all right, but I really wish the narration was, if not sped up, made a bit more... dynamic? Captivating? I don't really know; I'd experiment with the form, possibly adding more full pictures on the way and changing the backgrounds within a single scene - maybe zooming or panning them accordingly to what's going on? 

I cannot say, however, that I didn't like any of the story preceeding the ending. The humor was pretty good  - I liked the class clowns therater, the food ordering competition and the Baldy Bastard - even if he was a totally random character, not needed for the story itself; he made a nice 'LOL'-evoking addition.

As for the art - the character art was really great, looking at the sprites was really pleasant. I didn't like the full art pages as much, but they were good, too. What I didn't like were backgrounds being photos with some filter thrown onto them; having created a vn-like project myself, I know drawing backgrounds can be a real pain, but at the same time, they really make a difference. I can't say much about the music, as I had it muted down most of the time; the other times I didn't really notice it. I recall one or two tracks I really liked appearing somewhere near the ending.

I had that feeling One Thousand Lies tried to tackle a more philosophical theme using a normal, laid-back story, only getting more serious at the ending and few times throughout the play that felt too long and out of place for me; there was also main character's story. Personally I'd prefer if the whole thing was kept in the serious tone and was made shorter without beating around the bush so much, but I understand what the creator wanted to achieve. If you like kinetic novels and don't mind the slow pace, I'm sure you'll like it; if you prefer concentrated essence of your tale, stronger emotions or the ability to influence the story at all, you'll probably not be much interested in it.

32523732.review:
As a fan of Visual Novels, I was pretty excited to hear about this short (not to mention free) game. A friend of mine also recommended it with a lot of good things to vouch for. 
The first thing I noticed was the art style. It's fairly cute, and while there aren't many poses/expressions for each character, they ARE at least drawn well. 
The soundtrack for the game is cute as well, but it's insanely repetitive. There were 2 or 3 songs that I enjoyed but after hearing them over and over, you just get sick of them. 
As far as the story goes, I have to say I was extremely disappointed. It was unfortunate because the beginning sets you up with a lot of vague phrases and stories that draw you in, and the entire rest of the game is practically unrelated. It's not until the very end (like the last 10 minutes of the game) that they decide to connect everything and you're able to make sense of the plot. The characters also did not feel very relateable to me. While I did enjoy them and their characteristics, I still found them strange and had trouble understanding some of their reasons and motives so acting certain ways or saying certain things. All in all I had high hopes for this game but was ultimately disappointed. My experience will not be the same as others, but if you have less patience and enjoy relateable characters/story, then I would skip out on this one.

32419014.review: Don't get me wrong, I love the characters and their personality in their own way but the story was perplexing. More so, I don't really recommend this because of course, no options to choose your path and another is that the story was just a bit too jumbled. I know the ambiguity was what this game was aiming for but the plot of the story didn't really have consistency other than lies being the main point and wrapping everything up. The other thing was that it felt like there were fillers inside the story where it had nothing to do with the story. I get that it might've been used for seeing their lives but it just felt like forever before we could progress on with the story.  As for the side story that Ciar wrote; I think it would've been better to put those at the end of the chapters instead of midway of each chapter. Just my opinion, you can hate on it if you want but I just felt like a visual novel like this had so much more potential.

[h1]The game.[/h1]
[i]One Thousand Lies[/i] is the first VN written by Spanish independent developer named Keinart Lobre. The story has written in Spanish and translated to English.

This VN tells the tale of Ciarán Endyein, a liar writing the fable of a wolf longing to reach the sun. One day, Ciarán starts receiving enigmatic emails from a mysterious sender, turning his everyday life into a mess of a romantic comedy with psychological themes mixed in. What lies beyond the mystery he's been presented with? In the words of Harry H.: "If you want to know the truth, go find it".

Let's go to the good points. The art is good. The characters personalities were well-made and lively; they were attractive (both physically and spiritually), and realistic. The soundtrack seems decent, with a good variety and didn't get repetitive. As for writing, it's eloquent and well-made, with almost no grammatical errors. However, the translation of Spanish to English isn't 100% faithful, the own creator says that, but I'm sure he did the best within the possible.

Then comes the main part of a visual novel, the dialogue. Repetitive, boring, agonizing. Overall, this game it's just a novel, it bored me and made me angry. They're all talking about the same things, time after time, one character after another. The story is very, very long and very annoying. I appreciate Keinart's effort, seriously, but for me, definitely not.

[u]100% Achievement:[/u]
This game has only one achievement: 'Only the truth'. This achievement can be obtained by completing the whole story, which has not any choices you have to make, and then click on a 'hidden' text which finishes the story. So to start click on the yellow tab with a plus sign on it to start. It's quite a long story and if you don't like reading it all I recommend using a macro to go through the story really fast. Once you finished the story go back to the main menu and click on the text which says: 'One hidden truth'. Easy game for an achievement hunter.

[quote][h1]Positive points. (+)[/h1][list]
[*]Easy to get the only achievement.
[*]Nice art design.
[*]The characters are lively.
[*]Good writing.
[/list][/quote]

[quote][h1]Negative points. (+)[/h1][list]
[*]Too length (it's around 5 to 10 hours long).
[*]Repetitive story. The characters are over and over saying the same things, same dialogues.
[/list][/quote]

原本，我的确抱过“好好读完这个故事”的想法，但在花掉六个小时，读到大约三分之二的位置时，我也崩溃了……

不是因为庞大的文本量。

也不是因为过分散乱的文风。

而是因为Ziva……

哦——天！作者到底是本着怎样的精神做出 Ziva 的人设的啊，为什么一定要摆出那副欠抽的表情，敢不敢把左手放下来啊？全程叉个腰在那里指点江山， 半吊子社会心理学大段大段的拽，你知不知道只翻过几本书是不可以跑去给别人做心理指导的么？你知不知道即使是朋友指手画脚的也很过分啊？治疗是医生的工作，请不要擅自做奇怪的尝试，而且你先去治治胳膊吧，魂淡！隔着屏幕我都想照脸一脚！！！ (╯‵□′)╯︵┻━┻

呼.......

总而言之……这是个我个人相当“不认同”的故事，行文方式不认同，人物塑造方式不认同，主题三观也不认同。

想要阅读的同学请慎重地跳坑，大家不见得会像我一样讨厌Ziva，但作者琐碎成饼干渣一样的流水叙事风也不是好扛的。

当然，无论如何这只是个免费的视觉小说，音乐和画风都还是很不错的，除了Ziva以外两个姑娘的人设很讨喜，有时候一些片段设计的也非常有趣。此外，还有一个好拿的成就，嗯，暗搓搓的解锁跑也不失一件乐事……

31253269.review:
[h1]An absolutely amazing lie![/h1]

A couple of days ago I found this game "One Thousand Lies" in my library and I totally had no clue what it had to be and why I seemingly bought it. Eventually, it turned out I didn't buy it (since it's free) and it's a visual novel, so I decided to play it as I remembered it looked promising. And looks weren't deceiving this time, so I just want to immortalize my enjoyment of it here! Let me sum up what positively characterises this game for me:

[list]
[*]Fantastical absurd and sarcastic humour I haven't found so abundant in any game yet.
[*]Interesting characters with some less straightforward traits/behaviour.
[*]A story that flows really well and more importantly: [i]takes its time[/i].
[*]Alongside funny linguistic acrobatics, there's also room for thought-provoking matters.
[*]Contrary to many other novels, the soundtrack is so diverse, beautiful and fitting.
[*]One Thousand Lies easily surpasses many paid novels (with the reasons mentioned above). 
[/list]

I was surprised this game doesn't contain any choices, however, it didn't bother me as the story progressed well enough on its own. More importantly, the play time is much longer than most choice-based novels. The art impressed me less than the writing, music, story, etc. I do like the character art, and I'm not offended by the small amount of expressions they have. However, the backgrounds were pretty basic, and I'd loved to see some character art for a couple of side characters, for example.

My final verdict: I would [b]highly recommend[/b] anyone to try this game!

Still, I think the price is beyond the realm of reason... :)

30505984.review:
One heck of an awesome story.
There is so much to say about this game that is good that I don't even know where to begin.
Anyone that is even remotely interested in genuinely interesting sets of characters, in a story that might be a bit hard to understand at first(It gets pretty philosophical sometimes) but if you are able to take in all it's conveyed messages, becomes one of the most intricate and deep stories that I've ever read about Life(About society, the meaning of it, love and how deception and lies fit in to most of that).
Although the messages that fuel this game and carry the plot are pretty deep/meaningful, for the most part it still manages to carry a light tone, with the characters coming across many comedic instances that left me smiling till my mouth was sore.

Other things to mention: The story contains some metaphorical parts(so don't let it ruin your enjoyment if it strays from the realistic path a couple of times)
The Soundtrack is awesome , and enhances the enjoyment x2.

Overall: I recommend this little underrated masterpiece to every romanticus, everyone who has questioned where they would need to go with their life and what their place in society is, everyone who is bored of the stereotypical characters in visual novels and want characters that shine in their own unique way, and every reader that likes to just get lost in a good short story for 5-7 hours(5 chapters, each one takes an hour)

What are you waiting for?

30473456.review:
Тысячи лжи - длинная, кинетическая (без выборов) новелла с МногоБукв, и сюжетом обретающим логику ближе к концу. Также легкая +1 "идеальная игра" в профиль. Ибо только одна ачивка за запуск второй кампании которая откроется после первого прохождения.

1) [u]Сюжет[/u]: история крутится вокруг будней студента и его общения с друзьями (3 из которых девушки). Большинство диалогов примерно такие же которые бывают в студенческие годы, с друзьями под пиво после учебы. То есть если спросить о чем был разговор, ответ будет: "Ниочем, но было весело". Внятным сюжет становится только ближе к концу. Но имхо я не могу сказать что история меня чем то зацепила, вроде в меру весело, но реально ни о чем.

2) [u]Геймплей[/u]: новелла кинетическая, так что весь геймплей в чтении текста. Есть одна ачивка за запуск второй кампании которая откроется после первого прохождения. Если читать влом но хочется получить ачивки, ставим в настройках опцию пропускать весь текст, в игре нажимаем кнопку пропуска. После прохождения открываются галерея арта и музыки. Как сказано в аннотации - время прохождения действительно от 5 до 10 часов, но если идти только за ачивкой, то и 5 минут хватит.

3) [u]Графика и звуки[/u]: музыкальное сопровождение разноплановое и хорошо подобранное. Персонажи отрисованы замечательно, задники видимо обработанные фотографии.

4) [u]Язык[/u]: новелла на английском и испанском - за испанский не скажу, но английский в основном не очень сложный, но изредка встречаются различные психологические пассажи с которыми могут быть трудности.

[u]Как итог[/u]: меня лично игра не сильно зацепила, ибо все же люблю новеллы с более четким сюжетом. Но при этом данная новелла в целом неплохо сделана как в графической части, так и по музыке, так что палец вверх.
6 правд из 10

30346233.review:
There is no one who is more sincere with their words... than the greatest liar of them all.

В новелле One Thousand Lies нам поведана история совершенно обычного парня и его совершенно обычных будней. Пранки, веселье и смешные шутки, что, в принципе, типично для всех парней его возраста. Но чем дальше идет повествование, тем яснее начинает казаться, что здесь что-то не так. Появляется чувство, что чего-то не хватает, что рассказчик пытается что-то скрыть от нас. В чем правда? Кому можно верить? Ответы на эти вопросы придется искать главному герою. Но... можно верить ли ему самому?

Более полно описать сюжет, ничего не заспойлерив, к сожалению, нельзя. Хочется отдельно отметить профессионализм сценариста, которому удалось создать правильное настроение, подобрать действительно нужную музыку и построить весь сюжет так, чтобы читатель под конец почувствовал, что знает все и не знает ничего одновременно. Повязка с глаз спадает, но то, что мы видим перед собой — лишь туман и новые тайны. Это шедевр в своем роде, из всех новелл "психологического" жанра ему нет равных.

Почему-то подобные творения никогда не создаются в крупных компаниях. Их делают обычные люди, причем не из-за денег или славы, а чтобы выразить себя, донести до окружающих какую-то важную мысль. Сложно поверить, что весь сценарий был написан одним человеком, но это так.

Игра бесплатна. Попробуйте её, и вы никогда не забудете этой красивой истории, в которой психология и серьезные вещи тесно переплетены с загадками, весельем (и даже мемами). 

На тысячу лжей всегда только одна правда.

30056636.review:
Pros:
[list]
    [*] The Story - I like the overall theme about truth and lies especially on how it reflects the everyday actions of the characters like with his work [spoiler] the wolf and the moon which is a intriguing tie-up to the theme[/spoiler]
    [*] The Characters - It's really the character that makes or breaks a VN. We get to have a cast that bounces off of each other's peronality nicely.  Though I did find their actions cringey at times, overall they are endearing.
    [*] The Music - Piano and Jazz. Enough said.
[/list]

Cons:
[list]
    [*] The Structure - The high school hijinks could have been changed to something else or at least its frequency got toned down. It was humorous at first but it got old quickly. the scene could have been more creative. I understand the highschool setting makes for a very limited array of options to choose from but I expected more.
    [*] The Visuals - Honestly if I judge with the backgrounds alone then this should be in the pros list but there should be a lot more characters sprites with different poses to connect more with the scenes so monotone appearances throughout bothered me a lot.
[/list]

Overall a great free visual novel game and not bad since I ended up reading the whole thing. There's still a lot of room for improvement. It might not be something I'll read again but also don't regret giving enough time and attention to finish this

29919953.review:
祝诸君情人节快乐！

——顺便安利一部非常契合情人节基调的视觉小说游戏，我是说，如果你同我一样没有更加刺激的活动的话，为什么不尝试一点浪漫又谐趣的故事呢（惨兮兮的眼神望着你）。

免费视觉小说中往往有一些非常与众不同的作品，他们或表现着与众不同的题材，或有着深刻的思辨，或者传达着作者本人的心声——比如科幻-犯罪题材的Lucid 9，比如我即将试试的Sepia Tears，比如这部One Thousand Lies。或许在不必顾虑各种功利因素的同时，这些作者也得以摒弃所有俗套的故事和空洞的福利内容（当然客观上也没有这样的条件），而放手写自己想写的东西。作者想得到的也不是盈利，而是大家的正向反馈吧有兴趣的同学可以看看itch上连篇累牍的玩后感，以及作者本人同样长篇大论的回复。

虽说是免费的，但这完全不是粗制滥造的作品，几十首配乐（包含一些不错的钢琴曲），意外养眼的立绘和背景（第一眼就喜欢上了Luce！）以及最重要的，又流畅又幽默的校园生活段落，深刻而内省式的心理描写，以及动人的人物刻画（Luce真是越看越爱啊！）都是明证。我本来只是下下来想稍微看眼这是个怎样的游戏就作罢——但是却鬼使神差的看了十几个小时，忍不住为之而怦然心动（哦，Luce，这个名字虽然像月亮，但其实是太阳！）。

这是一个欧洲小镇青年和他的伙伴们甜蜜中带着点苦涩的成长与情感故事——这么说起来一点感觉都没有，想看更有趣的说明的话不妨看看商店页面上的简介与角色自述（天哪我真希望每个galgame的人设介绍都能是这个风格的），一眼就能看出游戏的与众不同。语言障碍可能是个问题，尤其是开场几个段落的内容比较复杂，不过只要过了这点，就会变成通俗口语的（虽然可能还是夹杂了些心理学术语吧）。我不知道故事里面带有多少自传体色彩，不过记住作者是个安达卢西亚人，他以一己之力把自己的作品从西班牙语翻成了英文，不会很难的。

当然，如果只是为全成就而来的话，这也是个全程ctrl一刻钟就能拿走唯一一个成就的游戏···不过你会错过更重要的东西的，嗯。

最后，Only the truth and nothing else but the truth，如果你还在想是不是该玩下此游戏的话，就试试吧，不会后悔的。

29653785.review:
One Thousand lies es una VN F2p en de duración mediana-corta que esta completamente en español.

En esta novela seguimos a un chaval de instituto con sus movidas, sus romances y sus mierdas. Esas cosas que no se describen en análisis por miedo al spoiler.
La historia y trama, aunque bastante buena, esta llena de diálogos de relleno, algunos son bonitos, divertidos  e incluso interesantes, pero que al final no dejan de ser un relleno que te puedes saltar.

El apartado visual es soberbio, de lo mejor que te puedes encontrar en una NV indie, a mi este apartado me ha gustado y resaltado mucho, pues es normal encontrar novelas amateur con dibujos robados de algún software  o con un nivel deplorable, y sin embargo, aquí esta muy bien llevado, e incluso en algo como los fondos lo cual es también bastante complicado lo han sabido llevar.

Los personajes son hermosos [spoiler]¡¡¡Claire best girl!![/spoiler] llenos de vida y carismáticos. ademas hablan un español al que estoy acostumbrado, no tan bestia como el mio en el que 5 de cada 4  palabras son insultos <===== aunque se agradece que se salte este pequeño detalle de la forma de ser aquí, y se agradece.

Y la música es de notable, en mi perfil a día de hoy veis 6 horas jugadas, una parte de esas 6 horas es que me he parado a momentos para escuchar ciertas melodías que me gustaban.


Para acabar, Keinart es uno de los creadores de esta novela, y gracias al maravilloso internet y a que él suele usar el mismo Nick ya me he encontrado bastante de sus perfiles. He pensado seriamente en agregarlo por los jajas, pero no quiero parecer un acosador [spoiler] Vaya, un poco tarde para eso[/spoiler], así que dejare este mensaje aquí para él: Buena Nv, espero la siguiente historia con ganas

29251146.review:
It's going to be a tough act finding another kinetic novel to read that measures up to this one. Couldn't have asked for a better induction into the genre and form. 

There were moments about two-thirds of the way in when I was getting a little bored, but good things come to those who wait. The ending is (for lack of a better phrase) explosively kinetic. Even when nothing much was happening, however, I felt compelled to continue by some inexpressible quality in the narrative. One Thousand Lies has the distinction of being the only game in my library to have incited me to whack the F12 key multiple times. Some of Ciaran or Claire's deep ruminative statements are just that memorable. 

I also don't usually pay attention to sound or music, but One Thousand Lies has one of the nicest, least-annoying-to-hear-on-loop soundtracks that I have ever encountered. This is one reading experience that will remain with me for a long while - plot, characters, music and all. 

Best of all, it's free! There's literally no reason to not try One Thousand Lies out if you're a fan of good storytelling in general.

29245225.review: This was a beautiful and inspirational story that left me crying after seeing the friendship and closeness between Chiran and the people surrounding him. The use of the Wolf's story temporarily was percieved as a tale of the struggle in the life of Chiran. The impossible goal of protecting everyone, that he so desperately wants but will never achieve. In the end, it appears to have a better and easier solution when all seems lost. The Wolf without companions or memories  represents Chiran, the man who wanted to forget his own memories because of the suffering he bought to all around him, the Sun represents his unfulfilled and uncompleteable promises that he so desperately wants to fulfill, and the Moon represents Luce, the one thing that filled him with the strength to continue another day and eventually his salvation. It was said that the story had no relevance by Ciaran and the author but I think that it is still a perception that the author intentionally left there. 'For one door to be entered, all others must be closed' defines that once a decision is made, no matter how hard you try, cannot be undone. Claire teaches him that this is false, and that you can always go back, that you can make mistakes and learn from them. I was not expecting much from 'One Thousand Lies' but there is so much self-reflecting that I have done thanks to this novel. It is the most touching piece I have ever read and I will continue to remember this novel throughout my life. The novel that made me question myself and reflect on how I affect other peoples lives. I would like to thank the development team for the time, energy and spirit they put into this project and the happiness that the answers bought me.

29086406.review:
我对这款游戏的态度嘛。。。看我的游戏时长估计也能看出来了。。。对， 我真的很喜欢这款游戏。 其实一开始我是抱着玩GAL的心态在看的，也有一点对里面的哲学、心理学内容有好奇心。所以一开始我确实是盯着几个女主角，估摸着每条线的恋爱结局。但是当我认真一口气通关（并不是刷成就）了以后我被剧情吸引了。嗯我马上进入正题。
这款游戏在好几个方面都是出彩的。首先是人设， 妹子们真的真的真的很有魅力， 画师真的太棒了！
然后就是剧情，整个剧情非常有趣和有深度，而且埋了各种各样的伏笔。（我是像一个侦探一样完成游戏的。）
最后就是穿插在里面的心理学、哲学内容，我不是这两个专业的，所以我很难从专业角度给出分析，但是我确信对于普通玩家而言这些内容不会造成理解上的困难， 或者更准确地说，绝对是加分项。
至于缺点的话主要有两个，一个是背景，包括背景图和背景音乐，背景图不少一看就知道是由真实的照片处理过弄出来的，老实说有时候这会让我脱戏。然后是BGM， 虽然不至于毁气氛，但是和场景的契合度有点低。。。在这方面日系的作品优势大一点。
另外一个问题是可爱的妹子们变化有点少，和台词和剧情会出现脱线的情况以及偶尔会有点崩，对，画崩这点我说的主要是CG图。

但是，总的来说，这款游戏免费，而且很有诚意，质量也完全超出了预期，再要损它有点太过苛刻。
总之我强烈推荐各位认真玩。（P.S要是有官方繁中或者简中确实会更方便玩）

28893487.review:
First of all, this is a kinetic visual novel. For those of you new/unfamiliar with this, then here is a quick explanation: read the description. Thank you very much for actually taking the effort to do so, and for those of you who did not read the description... Google it. On to the rest of this...

The story follows Ciaran and his close and new friends. It explores his present and past life, albeit rather ambiguously most of the time, in his senior year of high school. You read, you laugh, you get rather confused, then you go to sleep because the game became very complex and it is already very late for you to be up. The story contains lots of humor and references to pop culture along with not-so-pop-culture. I had plenty of laughs and I also did my best to get into the mind of the main character, however proving futile as my very few predictions were proven false, then some proven true, while others still nagging my brain for answers. Most of the questions that may come to mind while enjoying this thought-provoking story are answered, but some are not. And that's what made me enjoy it all the more. 

The characters are interesting, most of the time. The music usually fits the situation, however when I was listening to it, sometimes the music, unintentionally, took my concentration as I enjoyed quite a lot. And then there were moments where the music had gone with a beat I did not expect, taking me off-guard yet still being enjoyable. The art is pretty simplistic, but that's not a bad thing. It reminded me of the art of another free visual novel, which is not on Steam at the moment... The story was engaging throughout. It made me curious, happy, somewhat sad, and even more surprised by the plot twists. I may not have an eye for foreshadowing, but I was a little shocked by how the end turned out. Some things as I wanted, others not as I expected. However, if you do play/read it, then stick through with it to the TRUE end. It is well worth what some are hoping for.

I would recommend for anyone who reads visual novels. It has quite a bit of psycho-babble throughout, but if you read through it a time or two, it starts to make sense. I would alse recommend this to someone who doesn't read visual novels, however wants to read a usually sarcastic comedic story with a bit of romance and look into the base of the human psyche. For being something that is free, I had enjoyed it far more than some of the things I had actually paid for. 

And who doesn't like a main character who plays pranks/jokes on all of his classmates, especially when the opening (post-prologue) is one of the best pranks.

Just finished this visual novel, clocking in at 11 hours. The story was very engaging, even though it was just a novel! All the characters had their own distinct personalities, and I'm satisfied with what was provided. Your name is Ciaran, and the plot centers around a missing package followed by almost threatening emails from an unknown. Plot twists will arise, and that's what was almost to be expected in a game about lies.. yet, it was all done suddenly, making you want to continue on. Including you, the entire story is centered around 5 people [spoiler] and a cop/bartender/waiter/schoolgirl min-gun weilder [/spoiler]. If I had to classify the best factor in all this, it's the humor. There are just so many laughs that help you get back to realizing you're all just teenagers. Everyone is living the school life, which could be boring, unless you're a part of this exciting group.
There really isn't much to say as to not spoil the story, just give it a try. It's crazy how much content was provided, especially when it is for free (which was the reason I picked it up). This visual novel absolutely blows all other free ones right out the window. I have played others, but this one is just amazing. The free soundtrack provided is top-notch and a huge plus! HIGHLY recommended to any readers!

28722473.review:
Length: Short (2 - 10 hrs)
Avg read: 5 - 8 hrs.
Type: Kinetic Novel

Description: There is no one who is more sincere with their words...
... than the greatest liar of them all.

Based on a story that should be true, One Thousand Lies tells the tale of Ciarán Endyein, a liar writing the fable of a wolf longing to reach the Sun.

One day, Ciarán starts receiving enigmatic emails from a mysterious sender, turning his everyday life into a mess of a romantic comedy with psychological themes mixed in. What lies beyond the mystery he's been presented with? In the words of Harry H.: "If you want to know the truth, go find it".

Thoughts: Hate to not recommend a free game but I just didn't enjoy this slice of life comedy. The theme on lying and its effect on the mind of the user and the people around you is interesting but don't think a Kinetic novel is the way for it to be told. Other than the lying, the other story elements are okay but broken up to make it harder to follow the character's motives. 
Even if its hard to follow, the story is finished as well as it could be based on the theme and still feeling rooted in realism. 

Overall: 5/10 Average

28692014.review:
For a free visual novel, this really is a work of art. The character design is very clean. It looks like it's out of an anime with 3-D CG or even a recent P2P VN. The art itself is technically solid. Poses are done well, nothing really looks out-of-place. As for the background art, it's also well done, standing up where it should and laying low where it should. It's clean and bright, adding enough to the story that it doesn't completely take over.

Unfortunately, there are no character voicings, but the dialogue is so well done. All of the characters have well defined personalities and they interact naturally. It's as if they are alive. There interactions flow very well with the plot and each character isn't just a cookie-cutter stereotype, but unique individuals with their own histories, their own problems and their own motives.

The music also fits the scenes that are set. Placement and actual composition are both strong. Often times, Visual Novels that have weak music fail to keep me interested. I'll get bored after about 30 minutes because the experience is just so quiet and bland. None of that in One Thousand Lies.

Overall a very well-made piece. All of the elements tie together well. I didn't notice any bugs during my read-through. If the creators turned this from a kinetic novel into an actual visual novel they could probably sell a good amount of copies, although the writing would likely be weaker for side-routes due to the nature of the story revolving around the lies, how they build, and the one single truth at the end.

28651403.review: This was a fun VN game. No real choices to speak of other than if you want to continue on after the initial ending. But it is an interesting story with enjoyable characters. It could really do with an editorial pass as there are a lot of small issues with the writing (words in the wrong order, grammar mistakes, small continuity errors, etc). It also gets a bit weird and kinda long winded with some questionable philosophical expositions towards the end that are riddled with teen angst. But rough edges aside, it was a very enjoyable reading experience that I could fully recommend to any VN fans out there. The music was decent and fitting and the art style was good enough to not detract from the experience. This game would easily be worth $5 or so, but is free to play, so you can't really go wrong here.

28334870.review:
Taking place in an unnamed European country, in [i]One Thousand Lies[/i] you play as Ciarán Endyein, an average teenager in his last year of high school with a reputation as a class clown. Alongside him are his two best friends: confident ladies' man Ausse Ealdwine and amateur psychoanalyst Ziva Shani. It looks to be a rather boring time as usual for them as school goes on, but a couple of events change things for Ciarán. First, he begins receiving cryptic e-mails ostensibly related to a missing package. These lead him to encounter Luce Aurea, a competitive girl and an aspiring artist. He also runs into Claire Argyris whose conversations only seem to be more confusing than the last.

This game is a kinetic novel, that is, a type of visual novel with no actual player control and only one ending. Instead, the story is entirely linear and the game can be completed as quickly as the player can read it.

Overall my impression of this game is mixed. I suppose I should start with the positive aspects. First of all, I generally enjoyed the writing. There was some great incorporation of humor in this game and many jokes made me laugh out loud. I also found the characters in this game well written. Despite being a relatively shorter visual novel, there was still a good use of the time to fully develop the characters with distinct personalities. Another great aspect of the game was the music which was pretty good and appropriately used. Generally, the art was pleasing enough to look at and the game's interface works well.

Besides the humorous writing, the main aspect of a visual novel is the story. I thought it was pretty good and it does have the potential to make the player think. This is especially true due to the fact that you really have to play to the very end in order for all aspects of the story to really be put in perspective.

However, there were some negative aspects with this game. Each character is represented by only one sprite with a few different facial expressions. Even their clothes always stay the same. For example, one scene takes place during a basketball game where a character is shown wearing ordinary street clothes instead of something more appropriate. With only five main characters represented, more diversity could have been utilized. The other main problem was the addition of filler. It should only take 7-8 hours to complete this game, and yet many scenes that do not progress the story at all just seem to drag on for too long. I understand this was likely done to incorporate some slice-of-life situations, but it was excessive. 

Overall, while not a bad game, some aspects hold it back from being truly great. Is it worth the time? If you like visual novels with a focus on story, it would be worth a play. It is a shorter story and available at the low price of free, so you do not have much to lose. However, if you do not like visual novels, this is probably a skip.

28111527.review:
Acabo de terminarlo. 9 horas casi del tirón. Increible.

Me he reído hasta hartarme, me he emocionado tanto que he sentía aquello que he leído, he sentido el sufrimiento. He vivido la novela visual de principio a fin. Mis razones para recomendar esta pedazo de obra maestra:
[list]

[*]Era la primera novela visual que jugaba de esta manera (He jugado a alguna piratilla pero nunca me convenció.)

[*]Sus personajes con sus historietas de echar el rato me recuerdan a mi grupito. Hablamos de tonterías, nos inventamos cosas y vamos por las ramas cada dos por tres.

[*]Los temas hablados. El cómo se tratan, cómo se desvelaban preguntas y surgían otras, como acábaba todo, perfecto.

[*]La banda sonora, que también te viene gratis como DLC, me ha parecido sublime. Perfecta para la mayoría de las ocasiones, aunque pocas veces no me ha llegado a transmitir lo que tenía que transmitirme (Ojo, ha sido en muy contadas ocasiones.)
[/list]

Al principio crees que no es para tanto, y te tomas muy a la ligera la novela, pensando que va a ser una del montón. Encima es gratis, ¿qué se puede esperar? ERROR.

Recomiendo darle una jugada, disfrutar de los temas, darle al coco... y escuchar la pedazo de banda sonora.
Sobre los dibujos... No sé dar una opinión sobre ellos ya que no tengo un punto para poder diferenciar, pero me agradaron muchísimo.

10/10 aunque es más que todo por ser mi primera novela visual.

27632845.review:
This was actually the first VN I ever played/read/perused and I just saw it as a way to pass time, I mean it's free, nothing to lose other than a few minutes (enough time to know if it sucks).

As per my time record, it doesn't suck. It took me by surprise. Why? [b] I got invested [/b] then it [b] made me feel [/b]. Feels which I haven't felt for a long time.

The humor wasn't WOW or anything honestly, but the story itself. That's what kept me interested. It was weird, simplifying it, but it somewhat moved me emotionally, especially nearing the end since... I didn't expect it. It was free, the idea was that it'd be [i] meh [/i] but nah, it transitions from pseudo-action to 'woah, what, them?! And HUH?!' going to the finale, then it makes me shed a tear. That kind of thing is rare, unless it's Nic Cage (makes me do all three at the same time)

The build up through the middle of the story doesn't make it obvious either. Lots of us who played surely got the clues only AFTER we finished the thing. And I mean, FINISHED the thing ;)

Overall, it was an experience which I would have paid even 5 dollars for

9/10 (Hoped he'd hook up with the waiter, or the bartender, or that mini-gun student, but whatever)

27221364.review:
Aunque la única acción que se pueda realizar sea leer párrafos y párrafos de texto, esta visual novel en todos sus sentidos es, para mí, una obra maestra. Sinceramente, todo lo que tiene es magnífico: el diseño de los personajes (tanto en aspecto como en personalidad), los escenarios (que sí, que son fotos reales con un ''filtro'' de ''acuarela'' (?); pero es que los dichos son -creo que la mayoría- lugares concretos de España, porque cuando salieron por primera vez al patio del instituto flipé porque reconocí al instante la plazoleta que está justo delante de un centro comercial cercano, y la imagen del instituto parece la de un instituto también cercano...); y lo mejor, los diálogos, ese sarcasmo y esa ironía continuos, el vocabulario que utilizan para combinar las formas coloquiales con las formales (sobretodo el momento spanglish 'Murica filthy kebab xD), y los muchos, como podría decirlos... ¿gags?

En resumen, esta visual novel es una magnífica obra de arte y todo el que tenga dos dedos de frente y sepa dar oportunidades (incluso si no le gustan las visual novel) debería descargárselo y ''jugar''. Para mí, la mejor visual novel a la que he ''jugado'' hasta el momento. Carcajadas aseguradas.

26400666.review:
One Thousand Lies isn't a game. If you want any kind of gameplay, then you can ignore this visual novel. If you want a great story, then go right ahead and download this. 


One Thousand Lies is the story of Ciarán Endyein, an aspiring author, who with the help of his close friends stumbles into an interesting story not unlike one of his own, full of twists and turns. 


The characters are amazing; the two close friends share quirky and fun dialouge with Ciarán, but both them and the people we meet on the way also have many deep philosophical discussions with him. 


The characters are drawn in a really nice anime-esque style and the backgrounds, while simple, do their job. I haven't bothered to check if the music is original, but it's absolutely amazing, both on it's own and matched with happens on screen. 


In conclusion, this is a must-read for everybody who enjoys a good story, it's no masterpiece, but it's closer to it than what you'd expect.

OTL es una historia lineal, no puedes tomar decisiones ni mucho menos cambiar el rumbo de la historia. Solo te dedicarás a observar (En pocas palabras una Novela Cinética).

[spoiler]Opinión Personal:
Me encanto la historia, lástima que no pude elegir la chica con la cual yo quería que se quedará con el protagonista, pero si lo miras desde el punto de vista de la historia sería una relación falsa ya que ella estaba atada a él por las cosas ocurridas en el pasado, pero aun así con la que más me encariñe fue con ella. (Seguiré soñando, talvez algún día se haga realidad mi deseo y queden juntos).

Al terminar la historia principal y jugar la segunda parte OHT (Una Verdad Oculta) me dejo un mal sabor de boca, solo me da la impresión de que el protagonista es un acosador (Pero él lo justifica como: En resumen “Quería conocerte, no sabía cómo hacerlo y lo hice de la forma más extravagante”, si yo hiciera eso estaría en la cárcel xD, envidia :v ). Y el volver a jugarlo solo podría ver mentiras, fui completamente engañado por la historia...

Esta solo fue una opinión personal, cada quien tiene distintas formas de ver la historia y analizarla, mi intención no es ofender.[/spoiler]

Una pregunta ¿Cuál era el premio de la competencia?
[spoiler]Un beso de la chica más popular de la secundaria (Ziva), después de escuchar los comentarios de Ausse y Diniz solo llegué a esa conclusión. Alguien que me pueda decir porque siempre interrumpían, o me conformo con la respuesta de Ciarán TwT[/spoiler]

Si te gusta leer te la recomiendo. 10/10
