26183877.review:
great novel. after finishing it i am left with a mixture of emotions, too many to list, or to even express. this is a good thing, it leaves a sense of curiosity. especially with the ending at the well... end... it just leaves you trying to think of lots of futures for Ciarán, along with his friends, interests, and even some background characters. you're left at the end with lots of questions, possibly including (spoilers ahead)
who is the "baldy bastard" and why does he show up everywhere?
what was that "chain" from earlier all about?
how exactly did Ciarán get his scar (we know where, just not how)
and what is the minimum requirement for Ausse?
(spoilers end)
that last one was a joke (sorta)

these questions are ones you'll have to find out by your own means, and i, nor anyone else, can tell you the answer.

finally, i love the first person style the game has, allowing you, the reader, to see things through Ciarán's eyes.
in most graphic novels, you're shown what the main character looks like, but in this one, it's not displayed, you decide for yourself.
(minor spoiler) i, being shortsighted, relate to the main character in smaller ways, such as the fact he's shortsighted and wears glasses (spoilers end)

overall review? 10/10, love it, i hope future developers take this as an inspiration when looking for how to lay their novel out (shoulda said author)
definately recommend this!

26097034.review:
So, I finally decided to read this novel. I'm going to tell you right now, it is a VERY good novel. My own interpretation of the story is that it's about the lies we tell to protect ourselves from everything, the consequences of lies, the importance of such lies in place of the truth, how lies effect everything, the deceit that lies cause, and there's also a theme of doubt throughout the novel. It's truly a story you need to experience yourself, if not for the many things you can gain from reading about such realisms in, well, real life. I'm not the greatest person at explaining such concepts but the very end of the novel will wrap itself in a nice little bow and it all comes together. It's amazing. It was approximately 10~ hours long for me and I read at a decent pace. 


EDIT: Updated the review to reflect the *real* end because I missed it. If you play it, you'll understand. One specific thing I had to edit in was that doubts play a *very* big role in the game.

So, basically, I have a few theories on the ending but all I can say without spoiling anything is that... It's amazing how it finishes up. If you want to throw in your own thoughts, I'd love to discuss!

Oh, also, the soundtrack is amaaaaazing! 

This game is one I will always remember.

26058249.review:
INCREIBLE!
Acabo de terminarlo y me parece genial. 
Desde que la empecé hasta ahora me parece genial y me encantaría si alguien se anima a adaptarlo a algún anime o live-action. Seria increíble (aunque probablemente sea imposible, pero nunca se sabe).
El autor no sera un gran guionista, quizá la historia tenga fallos, su humor no sea el más elaborado y algunos personajes y textos se hagan en ocasiones pesados, pero OTL sabe a lo que va. Divertirte y emocionarte es lo que encontraras en esta Visual Novel. Y sobre todo un final, que, aunque extraño, es inolvidable.

26054285.review:
Hay novelas visuales que te hacen pasar un buen rato, otras que te hacen reír, otras que te hacen pensar, otras que te emocionan... One Thousand Lies es una de esas que harán todo esto y, sobre todo, no te dejarán indiferente.

Uno de los principales puntos fuertes que se puede apreciar en esta novela en las primeras horas es su sin duda su (excelente) humor, que hará que sueltes más de una carcajada, sobre todo con esas referencias que tiene a ciertos videojuegos y/o animes, que si tienes estos conocimientos saborearas esos momentos mucho más.

Tiene un elenco de personajes muy interesantes, que si bien me habría gustado que se desarrollaran un poco más no llega a ser un punto de negativo.

Y la recta final... es sin duda de las más sorprendentes que he tenido el placer de leer en una novela de este tipo por el momento, y el "One Hidden Truth" me emocionó muchísimo (si vamos, que lloré).

La verdad es que tras leer esta novela visual cuesta creer que sea la primera de su autor, porque realmente no puedo poner pegas "serias". Quizás sprites algo justos y que se me hizo corta debido a que estaba disfrutando sobremanera.

Así que, después de leer todo esto ¿sigues dudando sobre si la recomiendo? Está claro que SÍ, de hecho ya estás tardando en descargarte y disfrutar de One Thousand Lies.

This visual novel was [b]really[/b] interesting.

First off, this is a kinetic novel so it has no choices. So in that respect its more like reading a novel than an actual book. Don't like reading books very much and you probably won't enjoy this. But if you do like reading a good book than I very much recommend this! 

I found the character development to be very satisfing and the jokes pretty dang funny. It's kind of settled in the slice of life genre but it pulled of the daily life interactions very well, some moments serious and other's comedic. I won't spoil the story but there is a reason for the title. Not all events in the game may have been true so you have to analyze the main character's actions and dertermine what really happened. Even with the many lies in the story its still very enjoyable though. Its also free so you should have no reason not to check it out. Its a great value for anyone.

3. 剧情。The storyline doesn't make sense and maybe that's what the author wanted!以下是一个小时内的剧情[spoiler] 首先是一个关于三个伙伴与诅咒的寓言，画面一转是某刻薄的钢琴家与小孩对话。画面再一转是“我”和死党们演出了一场闹剧，接着是零碎的日常和打闹，完了“我”开始讲“我”的烦恼。我用爸爸的信用卡在网上买的手办被人绑架了。接着我收到了绑匪的神秘邮件，约我去公园。到了公园，先调戏了一个小萝莉，然后在儿童滑道遇到了一个画画的吾王（误）。我坚信她就是那个神秘人。正准备做进一步打探时，女孩不见了。然后和死党们汇报，接着莫名其妙的和死党男进行了赛跑，回家发现女孩是邻居但是被当成了跟踪狂，还莫名其妙的装了美国人（Excuse me?!）。。。之后又收到神秘人的邮件说了什么很厉害的样子，然后我去了体育馆，又遇见了那个女孩，莫名其妙的进行了一场比赛，解除误会后成了好朋友，然后发现女孩是死党女的朋友。。后面就跳了。最后小萝莉露出狰狞的笑容我是神秘人嘿嘿（看其他评论，貌似开发者比较认同小萝莉是分裂的人格。所以这是意识到独白太多，干脆弄个角色分担下吗。。等等，那手办是怎么回事）[/spoiler]

25291818.review:
I played this on Android, I think it was around 10 hours. I was about to stop reading this VN at the very initial chapters cause the school-pranks-stories are not my cup of tea, but I always complete a VN before judging/commenting it. So, at the end, I think my vote is something around 7-8 out of 10, that is good.

My pros and cons:

+It's a spanish VN (I like to read VNs from different countries, as each of them has its own style)
+Writing: the english version which I played is written very well
+Music: the music is nice, it has its own style. The theme I liked the most is the wolf's tale theme (Vagabond), it fits very well to the story-in-the-story.
+Duration: not too short, not too long, I think it's balanced
+BG Images: I really liked the drawing style effect of the backgrounds, even though they're not very detailed they gave me the feeling I was watching photos
+Sprites: I liked the characters' sprites, all the characters are well-drawn, even though some facial expressions are a bit too similar.
+Characters: they're ok for me, pretty different from each other, can't choose a favourite one as they all contribute to the story
+Plot: You have to go through thefull story (One Hidden Truth included) to get a whole picture about it, and I think it's nice. I liked the references and connections between truths/lies. As the title says, it's about it.
+I appreciate the fact that you've put notes and explanations near some of the rpy sentences, it's really helpful for translators

-Interaction: it's just a story to read with no choices, alternative endings nor minigames
-CG images: they're ok, but there are only a few of them, I would've liked to see more pics about the protagonists

25025695.review:
[h1] "One Thousand and One Lie."[/h1] 
First of all : when it comes to rate novels, i don't like to use that "10 score" standard system. Instead of it, i just decide for myself whether i liked or disliked the story. "One Thousand Lies" hits the point with it's unique great characters, background music and ,of course, the strongest part of this novel - mindbreaks (i could use another word, but it would be censored anyway). Also, there are some nice reffers to Steins;Gate, Greek mythology and stuff. For the first hours of reading you could think that it's another common tale with another common plot. And you know what? You're just a poor little fish - you've got caught in the nets of a Lie. 
My advice is to read it carefully and pay attention to details, because there is so much truth (lie) to uncover. Trust yourself only and don't get fooled by attractive and cute characters. But still, remember one thing : behind one thousand lies there is always one hidden truth.

P.S. "One Thousand Lies." After finishing it, i turned on "30 seconds to Mars - Beautiful Lie". Really, such a beautiful lie to believe in... And then... "One Hidden Truth" - the epiloge. There is not that much to say : after finishing it, welcome to "Discussions" section. There you'll find all the answers and great theories from some experienced readers and even developer himself, if you are interested.

P.S.S. [spoiler]Why "One Thousand and One Lie" ? The answer is so simple : Luce just can't be that perfect girl. She's probably the best waifu so far. It's really unreal to find an equal one IRL. Another beautiful lie, eh...[/spoiler]

25021131.review:
TL;DR: I can't tell you if the game is worth your money or not since it's free, however I can tell you if it's worth your time. The answer to that is a resounding yes. Whether you're new to the visual novel genre or a seasoned veteran, I think you'll enjoy this one.


First things first, there are no choices in this VN. If you come in with those expectations you may be disappointed, but don't drop it just yet.

I didn't bother reading the reviews before downloading, so judging by the first hour or so I was under the impression that this was just a light-hearted comedy. As the story progressed, I realized just how wrong I was. It gets a bit TOO real and depressing at times. I'd rather not get too much into the story, I think you'd enjoy it more if you went into it knowing as little as possible. I will say that it gets confusing though. The beginning is pretty confusing, the ending is confusing as hell. I'm still not 100% sure about what happened, but at least it left an impression.

It starts out a little slowly in terms of plot development, but just watching the characters interact with each other is a lot of fun. They all have a very distinct personality and way they interact with the main character. This isn't to say the characters are predictable, even if that may seem to be the case at times. Most of the main cast have their own running gag that seems to never get old. I could listen to Ausse's corny pick-up lines all day.

The humor in general was what really got me hooked at first. I don't remember the last time I've laughed this much while reading something. The abundance of references and occasional black humor really appeal to me, that's probably the case for most internet dwellers. 

The length and art quality were definitely not what I'd expect from a free title. It took me 8 hours to finish it, and while that may not be very long as far as VN's are concerned, I'd even be willing to pay ~5€ for it. The UI is very slick and functional, something I always appreciate.
I love the character art, it's not your generic anime style. It's a breath of fresh air. The backgrounds on the other hand.. not so great. You won't spend a lot of time staring at them though, so it's not a huge problem in my eyes. Another thing I'm not very fond of is the CG, the characters look very different. I almost didn't recognize the character at all when they showed the first CG image. Maybe that's just me though.

As a word of warning, there is some philosophical, "2deep4me" type stuff not everyone will enjoy. I'm sure you'll live through it.

24912496.review:
No me puedo creer que me haya encontrado una novela visual tan llena de españoladas de humor absurdo en su guión, y que al mismo tiempo funcione de maravilla como un romance poco convencional y una exploración psicológica tan potente.

Lo digo claro: One Thousand Lies me ha hecho tener esperanza por la creación de NVs en España, y me ha hecho recuperar más gusto por el género en sí. La barrera de entrada para disfrutarlo es nula, ¡este juego es gratuito, no hay excusas! Y además está en el idioma de Cervantes (por obvios motivos), algo tristemente excepcional en estos productos.

La historia (sin decisiones a tomar, pero con... cierto giro en su final) es una montaña rusa emocional que sabe mantenerte agarrado con su dosis justa de humor combinado con fuertes momentos dramáticos. Sus personajes están muy bien contruidos, y te dan sorpresas de principio a fin, acompañados con un diseño llamativo y expresiones faciales eficaces. Ciarán y sus amigos son el centro de atención de un argumento de escala pequeña, pero bien hilado.

La única flaqueza que se me ocurre sobre el guión es que los momentos emotivos caen con demasiada facilidad en un "infodump" con personajes soltando discursos bastante largos. Pero a título personal no puedo ponerles pegas, ya que dichos momentos tocan teclas que me resultaban eficaces, y sabían "buscarme las cosquillas" en un buen sentido. Por otro lado, nunca llega a ahondar mucho en los temas que toca, pero se asegura de rascar lo bastante como para animarte a ponderar.

A nivel artístico siento que se ven más las costuras: aunque el diseño y las expresiones de personaje son buenas, noto anatomía extraña, trazos confusos, y sombreado irregular. Las CGs, además, cuentan con composiciones y poses estáticas, que se me han hecho algo sosas. Los fondos, por otro lado, tienen toda la pinta de ser fotografías retocadas, un recurso que de por sí no es malo, pero que da la impresión de falta de recursos. Aparte de eso, tengo la sensación de que la composición de "sprites" pierde fuelle a medida que avanza el juego, y mientras recuerdo usos decentes de la "cámara", con movimiento de gráficos, o pequeños zooms, solo me vienen a la mente en los compases iniciales.

Como punto extra, a nivel de diseño gráfico la calidad es muy buena. Menús bien planteados, compuestos, fáciles de entender y muy funcionales.

El diseño de sonido es funcional, aunque estándar. La música es buena, y está bien empleada, aunque echo en falta más efectos de sonido. Este juego no cuenta con voces de ningún tipo, lo cual no me ha dado problemas, pero hay gente que le da importancia (saberlo no está de más).

El título es corto, en un par de tardes te lo puedes terminar perfectamente y con calma. Pero con eso dicho, el contenido está bien repartido, no he sentido que la historia se quede coja en ningún momento, y todo está en su lugar.

Las pegas que le pongo son mera cuestión de recursos/presupuesto en muchos casos. Tengo que dejarlo claro porque, siendo un producto gratuito, se puede decir en plata que "no le pidamos peras al olmo". Como producto de presentación para el creador, es un inicio realmente fuerte, y si se atreve a embarcarse en un proyecto de más embergadura tiene mi más absoluta atención.

Su guión es fantástico, y a pesar de las pegas artísticas no te saca de la historia. Sabe tocar muchos palos en su justa medida, y se atreve a darte sorpresas hasta el último momento.

Definitivamente recomendado, ¡basta decir que esta es mi primera reseña de Steam y hasta ese punto me ha inspirado el juego! Además, insisto, ¡es gratis! Jugando a One Thousand Lies solo puedes salir ganando.

PD: Me declaro fan acérrimo del Calvo-Cabrón.

24770229.review:
This is a decent enough 'My First Visual Novel' if you're a teen.  It's basically a light novel Japanese style where nothing ever gets too complex and it's all about the character and dialogue.

The character art is nice, but there are only one or two shots for each character and the backgrounds are thowaway digitized.

The spoken dialog isn't bad if you don't mind everyone being terribly witty, and can even be funny at times.

The non-spoken text is just amazingly overwrought in the teen novelist way where you try to pile in as many adjectives and similies as possible. Actual text from the game: 'I can still taste the crisp, bittersweet flavor my mind gave to the air on the day I found him, staring so intently at the starry sky, as if he wanted to leave the rest of the world behind.'

So if you like light novels or don't know if you like light novels this might be for you, and it's free.  If you're used to more adult stuff it's just going to be eyeroll city.

Esta obra le hace honor al nombre del genero, pues a diferencia de otras visual novels, en esta no hay desiciones, y lo unico que debemos hacer es presionar la tecla para que el dialogo avance. 

La historia en general es buena, podria catalogarla como un Slice of live con tintes de drama y mucha comedia, la unica queja que tengo es la importancia que le dan a cierto personaje con diversos trabajos... y sobre todo la parte en la que este personaje aparece en la escuela.

Los personajes son etrañables, les tomas cariño rapidamente sobre todo por esas bromas internas que hacen constantemente para molestarse entre ellos, es una relacion de amigos creible (salvo por algunos detalles) y que sin duda te haran soltar una carcajada o minimo sonreir. 

La banda sonora, es acertada, sobre todo las partes de Jazz que estan hermosas, gracias Mathew Pablo. 

En resumen, una muy buena obra que si bien, no busca ser rompedora o MUY profunda, resulta muy entretenida a la cual es facil tomarle mucho cariño.               Esta obra me hace sentir nostalgico.

24515033.review:
Ainda que o jogo seja em inglês (ou espanhol, alternativamente) e quem for jogar provavelmente sabe ler inglês suficientemente bem, sinto que devo contribuir para avaliações (ou como quer que "reviews" seja traduzido na steam em pt-BR) em minha língua mãe. Infelizmente, devo avisar que a avaliação pode conter spoilers, pois acho que não consigo passar minha completa avaliação sem um pouco disso. Se quiser ler ainda assim, vou deixar vários pontos de exclamação no começo e no fim do trecho de spoiler.

Eu estou numa fase ruim da minha vida. Depressão e dificuldades me matando aos poucos. Isso tem me feito fugir de qualquer ficção que traga drama e peso para minha mente fragilizada. Nem mesmo como catarse tem funcionado. Tenho corrido para ficções leves e bem-humoradas, felizes. E foi isso que me trouxe até One Thousand Lies.

OTL (hehe) me deu, a primeira vista, exatamente aquilo que eu queria, uma história leve, com personagens divertidos em situações curiosas e engraçadas e agradáveis de ler. E a falta de tomada de decisões me livrava do encargo pesado de decidir para onde a história estava indo. Eu estava apenas no banco do carona, vendo a história passar por mim enquanto o narrador me guiava por ela.

E devo dizer que a apresentação foi magistral. Apesar dos pouquissimos quadros de arte, e a maior parte do tempo ser apenas fundos e sprites com poucas variações, a história foi ótima. Piadas, referências, tudo leve. E situações engraçadas. Eu me deixei enganar, mesmo sabendo que uma trilha de drama estava sendo deixada, e um grande sinal de aviso em forma de prólogo já tinha me avisado do que estava por vir. Mas eu continuei me deixando levar por mil mentiras.

E o drama veio. E bateu com força. E mesmo sem entender tudo, e um pouco frustrado por isso, eu cheguei contente com ao final das mil mentiras. !!!!!!!(E aqui solto os SPOILERS, se quiser parar). Eu cheguei contente. "Melhor waifu venceu", pensei. Estava perdido nas mil mentiras, na maior de todas, eu acho. E aí o jogo me revelou, sua verdade escondida. Que ele diz ser uma mas são algumas. Mas acho que entendo porque "one hidden truth". Eu... não sei se estou contente, logo após "ler o jogo", ler a verdade escondida, com ela. Eu acho que estou contente também. Mas acho que diz algo sobre o que estou passando, que a verdade escondida que me deixa alegre, me deixa com um gosto amargo na boca sobre a mentira desmascarada que havia me alegrado pouco antes.!!!!!!!!!!

Então, o que posso dizer sobre o jogo é. Arte boa, trilha sonora ótima, duração satisfatória, uma escrita muuuuuito bem elaborada, e uma narrativa que não deixa nada a desejar, e lhe dá o que rir, o que pensar, o que conflitar internamente. Definitamente uma boa viagem emocional para curtir, que eu me surpreendo que seja gratuita, mas vejo como algo bem-vindo. Não vai lhe custar nada jogar além do tempo de reflexão depois, então, leia aí! Garanto um ... jogo(?) de qualidade!

24456425.review:
No me considero un experto en visual novel, ni mucho menos, pero se puede decir que llevo a las espaldas unas cuantas horas jugadas, en el género. Con "One Thousand Lies" me he encontrado con una VN con buen fondo e ideas, pero al final no han sido llevadas correctamente al producto final. El diseño, el arte, la música y sobretodo la tipografía y la paleta de colores le dan un acabado completamente profesional. La idea y hacia donde va dirigido el guión también es bueno, se nota que ha habido trabajo detrás de ello, pero tristemente se queda ahí, porque donde falla es en la ejecución.

Sinceramente, me ha sido muy duro seguir diálogos agotadores y de temas incluidos con calzador. Puedo resumir sin despeinarme que más del 70% de los diálogos son completamente superfluos, y que no aportan absolutamente nada a la trama principal. Si en una visual novel te saltas a la ligera 10 o 20 minutos de diálogos, y cuando sigues leyendo, te das cuenta que no te has perdido nada; es que algo falla.

No digo que la trama principal sea mala; todo lo contrario, pero queda tristemente eclipsada por el protagonista principal: el relleno. Es como si a un buen bistec le tiramos litros de mayonesa: ¡no!, la idea principal no era un triste pollo de KFC para que camuflaras su dudoso sabor original con especias.

Y por último, si una historia está bien contada, no es necesario hacer un episodio extra, la misma narrativa ya te tendría que llevar hacia esas conclusiones. Pero en cambio, no han sido muy eficaces esas cientos y cientos de lineas de texto.


[b]Género[/b]

Respecto al género, es una kinetic novel. Ya que la idea y el tema es bueno, tal como lo desarrolla, pide a gritos que sea un ren'ai. Los varios finales y tramas darían mas sentido y mucho más juego hacia donde pretende encaminar el tema principal. Pero se queda en una simple kinetic novel. Una pena, la verdad.

[b]Valoración[/b]

Si me hubiese parecido malo, ni tan solo escribiría un análisis. Es más, hasta pondría 2 o 3 lineas para avisar que la gente no lo juegue. Pero éste no es el caso.

24423284.review:
I'm borderline about whether I recommend this game or not.  Do I deduct marks for falling short of something truly great, or reward them for getting close?  It stayed with me enough to write this review, but not enough to go through it a second time to pick out the nuances (maybe some day in the future. Maybe).

On the plus side: The backstory is brilliantly crafted, the characters have moments of genuine humanity and funniness, as well as a surprisingly emotional conclusion. The music is effective, too - setting the scene without distracting. The visuals are nice, the backgrounds giving a real sense of place rather than the generic 'school/home/cafe' scenes.

On the minus side: There's some dense and uninteresting dialogue, a lot of it concentrated in the first third of the story - I actually stopped after the second meeting with Claire, bored with the endless verbose verbiage that didn't seem to be going anywhere (as enjoyable as the moments in class with Ziva and Ausse were, they didn't point to an ending that I felt compelled to follow through to).

To me, the actual story begins at the birthday party, when the abstract philosophising and slightly improbable character introductions give way to actual things happening.  And from this point on, there is a solid and quite powerful narrative; the reveal of Ciaran's backstory feels real, and there's plenty of moments that felt like actual teenagers interacting that are quite engaging.  

Ausse is excellent comic relief - a hard role to do well, and his interactions with Ciaran are genuinely fun. Ziva's sniping with Ciaran also has a nicely realistic feel. Diniz is a little underdeveloped, especially given his importance as revealed in the end.  Claire felt unrealistic; didn't quite fit with the rest of the characters, and not in an intentional way.  Luce had interesting depth. And Ciaran himself, rather than the usual two-dimensional narrator, has a compelling backstory that puts everything into perspective.

Which makes the unrealistic parts that much more jarring - when the cop pulled over the car, it was amusing; when the bartender broke the glass, it felt a little forced; when the waiter went over the top, it was a sort of mix of the two, I smiled but felt it breaking the suspension of disbelief just a little.

It's a mashup of things that work and things that don't - if I'd paid money for it, I would have been genuinely annoyed at the point where I first stopped playing, and I would have missed out on the very good bits after that point. Given that it's free, and taking all the very-good parts into consideration, I would recommend this; I just wish the story as a whole could have been the shining gem that's half-buried amidst the so-so ore.

24356010.review:
It's been a few months already since I played this, before it was greenlit. But today I stumbled upon the notes I took while reading and, oh man, I owe it some words.

The plot and themes are deceptively simple and grounded, light hearted even, which is why I would recommend this to anyone wanting to have their first go at the genre. And there's no way to screw yourself over and getting an anticlimactic pooey end midway through the game by clicking the wrong box once either, so there's that. The flipside to this is that, well, you can't screw yourself over. That is what a kinetic novel entails, though: you have one fixed narrative, and you click wherever to continue reading and looking at pretty pictures. Also it's free. That's three reasons, and you should only need one to go and try it out.

For everyone else out there, here's three reasons for you, too:

1) The way the plot is layered makes it so that it can be enjoyed on multiple levels, depending on whether you're having a giant cup of black coffee while staring at Ziva's breasts and clicking furiously or not. I recommend you do. There's a great amount of detail put into the game and you will miss a lot of it. Your second playthrough will consist entirely in hunting the little rascals, be it references to other stuff, foreshadowing or hints as to what in the name of hell is actually going on. If you're like me, you'll end up with several pages of notes, quotes, and silly comments. And you will love it. But if you're a functional member of society you can just read it once, feel a warm fuzzy feeling in your stomach that resembles happiness and go home. Or stay there, or whatever. The prose itself might be a bit iffy at times (although it's generally decent), but the overall narrative is extremely well thought out and solidly constructed.

2) It takes full advantage of its medium in a way that reminds me of, say, Metal Gear Solid 2. Kind of. Not that they've got anything in common, but yeah. Alright, forget that. What I meant is that it would never work as a book, or a movie, or an RPG, or even a visual novel with multiple routes and branching decisions (oh, [i]especially[/i] not as one of those). It's nice to see an amateur work that's not just some badly written anime without, well, any animation. Each and every element is crucial and you should pay attention to them all, including the UI.

3) The music is pretty good, but the way it is used is even more worthy of praise. OK, maybe not, making music is quite hard. But it's true that it's very well utilized. Every track matches perfectly with the situation it's supposed to enhance, and it's never used just because it's cool or whatever. This, of course, is a given when talking about games with professional sound directors in the credits, but this is not the case, so it's surprising. Effects are very well placed too, even if some of them sound like crap.

Also it's free. That's 4).

On the minus side, they could really use an editor to polish some of the writing, and a dozen artists willing to work for free too. Or an actual budget, whatever.

24231269.review:
(Yes, if you're wondering about my playtime, I played it three times.)
This visual novel was simply amazing, and left me with conflicted emotions beacuse of how beautiful it is. The mood of the story changed quickly at times, from immature to serious in a couple of sentences, which gave it quite a unique flavor. You play as a graduating student with the personality of class clown, experiencing his life and adventures with his little group of friends, all the way until graduation day... and sometime after.
The plot itself was a bit above average, filled with twists and turns that made it interesting enough (even though sometimes it just became plain ridiculous, but still, not exactly bullshit), and as the story progresess we can see how it's all connected, to become one big perfect "story"... (or as I should say, "lie")
It's mainly dialogue based mixed with moments of the protagonist's own thoughts or reflections, and the jokes made me laugh over half of the time: teasing, countless references, and more.
The realtionships of the characters were quite well knitted, and the dialogue explored a range of topics, making it stand out from other games/visual novels of it's genre. 
The art was pretty okay, at least for the charcter sprites. The background was the classic "blurred photos" trick, but it fit quite well.

9.5 out of 10.

[spoiler] For those confused about Claire, my theory is that whenever she was mentioned or adressed by other characters in the game, it was always in Ciaran's imagination. The others were, in fact, adressing Ciaran, but he used the "Claire" fragment of his mind answer or acknowledge them, while they had no idea of Claire's existence... [/spoiler]

[b]PROS: [/b]One Thousand Lies is probably the most well-written free Visual Novel on steam currently. The character art is beautiful, there are big laughs, and it is easy to grow fond of the characters. Everyone defies stereotype and  Information is piped to you in a digestable fashion, making this easy to pick up and put down as needed without getting confused. Music is A+.

[b]CONS: [/b]I would've liked to see more CGs, and more character frames. For how lengthy this one is, the same graphics get a little tiring. The backgrounds are also filtered photos, which I've never been fond of. I would've liked to see more characters in the world itself as well. The end doesn't knock the ball out of the park like I know the author is capable of, but it at least feels definitive and their idea feels fully realized.

[b]WORTH: [/b]One Thousand Lies is pretty long! If you've got time to sink into a story, I'd say it's definitely worth your while for the sweet price of free.

[b][u]OVERALL:[/u] [/b]I knew the moment I booted this game and saw the game's style, I stumbled onto something special. I am absolutely not a fan of kinetic VNs. I figure if I want a linear story, I can go read a book. This story though, this dialogue, and the amount of hours you get out of it: It transcends my preferences and delivers one hell of a cute, fun ride.

Normalerweise empfinde ich die meisten dieser Spiele, ohne Entscheidungsstränge als eine Art entspannenden Zeitvertreib. Oftmals seichte Geschichten mit vielen Charakteren und  der ein oder anderen humoristischen Einlage oder Anzüglichkeit.

Dieses Spiel ist anders und zwar nicht im negativen Sinn. Am Anfang mag es langatmig und vor allem, für Nicht-Muttersprachler besonders, sprachlich recht anfordernd sein. Aber wenn ich nun, am Ende der Geschichte, bedenke welche Liebe zum Detail bei dieser Erzählung mit all Ihren widersprüchlichen Wendungen und Ereignissen und Ihren so schillernden Persönlichkeiten spürbar wurde bin ich froh, die Ausdauer und den Willen zum weiterlesen gehabt zu haben.

Ein kostenloses Spiel, eine Steam-Errungenschaft, ....aber am meisten eine wundervoll gestaltete Geschichte, die den mitfühlenden Leser mehr als einmal über Ihre kleinen und doch so tiefgründigen Anspielungen nachdenken lässt.

Ich kann das Spiel somit jedem der keine Sakura-typische Story sondern etwas "weniger seichtes" sucht sehr ans Herz legen.  10/10 und definitiv eines der besten Spiele dieses Genres welche ich je gespielt habe.

24009741.review:
(There may be some spoilers ahead)

Pro's:
- It's free.
- It's quite long, for a VN (4hrs or so)
- Art is beautiful.
- Created by one very talented guy, whose work I would definitely consider picking up in future.
- Plot twists.

Cons:
- Apparently, there were a lot of references to things which I completely missed. Partly my fault, but I can't help but feel I'd have enjoyed the story more if I had.
- Story is, for the most part, a bit convoluted and has big gaps - especially at the end... the main one being the question as to where the hell did Claire go? How come everyone could see her, and talk to her, but then she just became a figment of his imagination?
- On that note, Claire looked about 5 years old. The artwork here was a bit disturbing.
- Characters were missing (Luce's father, the substitute teacher, Ciaran's family, and so on) which made it feel incomplete.
- I didn't like the main character. Personal opinion, but he was very, very irritating at times and at points I felt like turning it off, simply because of how much of an idiot he was.
- Some of the things that happen are completely unbelievable, and break the fourth wall.
- Some of these events were not just strange, but ridiculous. (Air gun fights, the policeman showing up 4 times, and so on)
- In line with the above, there's no way some of these things would have just randomly been allowed to happen.

Overall:
A good effort, and well worth the read (especially considering the price), but it is flawed - but I'm still recommending it, because it's interesting and, on the whole, very well written.

But, be warned. It's weird, and at times annoying, and the whole Claire situation is disturbing.

Звичайно і тема кохання і трохи сліз тут є... [u]АЛЕ ЯК ЦЕ ПОДАНО![/u] Кошерний художній стиль (як письма, так і артів), стереотипні проте "живі" персонажі, глибокий психоаналіз головного героя, багато філософських підтекстів, витончений гумор і атмосферний [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=t7K3akysrUI]саундтрек[/url]. - це все що робить цю новелу однією із кращих. Якщо ви очікуєте побачти когось із персонажів голими, то спішу вас розчарувати (не те щоб я був проти еротики, але деякі автори псують всю атмосферу напихаючи в свої ВН хентай).
Після проходження у мене точно з'явилось кілька тем для роздумів.
Єдиний мінус, відсутність локалізації. В теоріїї існує RU локалізація від ZOG, але у мене вона так і не встановилась. А враховуючи філософські роздумі і психологічні терміни (та і велику кількість художніх зворотів вплетених автором), повністю вникнути в історію без як мінінмум знань англійського вище середнього, майже неможливо.

[b][u]Вердикт[/u][/b]: Якщо ви фанат ВН або просто любите читати (чи хоча б думати головою), то сміливо качайте. Гра по якості перевершує 90% відсотків того сміття, за яке з нас хочуть збити грошей (до того ж саундтрек до гри, також безкоштовний).

23539406.review:
"The thing we're both embarrassed about can become something we share, our little secret. Didn't I say it before? Two people can't truly become friends until they share a secret between them" Mysterious Girl X

One Thousand Lie clichéd storyline is covered by it fun and distinct character.

[h1] STORY [/h1]
The story start off with you playing as Ciaran, a complicated and sophisticated student who don't like to be criticized and always think that he is right. He have two friends named Ziva and Ausse. Ziva is a girl who likes to tease you while Ausse is the boy who Ziva and you like to make fun off. On one day, you got a mysterious email telling you to meet somebody. And then you found mysterious girl X. The story is about finding who she is. While it's not surprising, the story sometimes tackle with their daily life, making us know a bit more about their life.

Ciaran and his friend speak like Shakespeare, so expect their word to be colorful, confusing, and ridiculous at the same time. They like to talk about that is not real and stupid, but I myself adore this stupidity. This colorful word from each character help the clichéd setting to be covered by it fun and ridiculousness 

[h1] Art and Music [/h1]

The art of the character is the regular anime style. Though all of them wear the same drinking clothes everyday, which is weird. One of the character (Ziva) wears a clothing like she is from some sort of sexy RPG, even on school which is also weird. If you want use that clothes, try to use it when she use it as regular clothes. Not on school. Anyway that mildly bothered me while playing.

The music also have trumpet and saxophone, so yeah. I like it.

[h1] Conclusion : While it's story is predictable, it offers a fun little journey with it's character and good music that you should try if you are a fan of Visual Novel. (8/10) [/h1]

Edit: The story goes darker and reflect the game title.

23484493.review:
One Thousand Lies is a free kinetic novel, so I thought I would pick it up for the (easy-to-get) achievement. However that eventually became secondary, as the story gave a very lasting impression on its own merits.

It starts off slow, and sometimes launches into large amounts of exposition when the characters were discussing their perspectives. The extensive vocabulary used was sometimes difficult to follow, and I was tempted to skip them and advance the plot, but fortunately did not as they provide insight into each characters' personalities and allow the reader to be emotionally invested in them, setting the context for the later parts of the story. Puns, hidden meanings and references also kept the dialogue entertaining and helped offset the pace somewhat. The music helped to set the tone for the scenes in the prologue but I turned them off afterwards and therefore cannot comment any further.

[spoiler] Actually reading the text will clue the reader in to hints throughout the novel that there is something else behind the narrated events. The overarching story is an adaptation of Greek mythology (Pygmalion), and the protagonist also did a bit of "foreshadowing" (quotes needed), which was explored towards the end. [/spoiler]

The conclusion was not satisfying as it still left several loose ends unresolved and raised a few questions, so be sure to read the extra chapter that is unlocked afterwards (which is required for the achievement anyway). However, I had to head to the discussions for the final "truth" behind the story and to fill in certain gaps I had while reading (I did not complete the novel in one sitting).

One Thousand Lies is a well-written story that is almost certain to give some "feels" upon completion. Not requiring any monetary sacrifice makes the novel much more accessible, so you should read it if you like plot twists, humour and mindfucks, and have a few hours to properly give the attention it deserves.

Exelente trabajo, de verdad, este es uno de las primeras novelas visuales que e podido seguir, su etapa inicial a sido muy confusa, pero apesar de todo, fue un buen material para ir escalando gradualmente hacia arriba con tan buen material de 01/10 a 10/10, y por eso RECOMIENDO esta novela visual de corazon, se a ganado sus puntos, por otro lado, buena trama, psicologico, buen humor, entre otras palabras, si entras en el personaje la lectura te llevara hasta donde presisamente tiene el mensaje analitico en forma de obra literaria narrado por el prota, su forma de aplicar el romance en la historia es inusual e indirecto, lo que motiva mas a seguir la novela y de convertirla en una verdadera obra de arte. 
Esta gran obra me a marcado profundamente, me a hecho sentir una gran fecilidad y por ello siempre estara en mi corazon, por eso les agradesco al autor y a todos aquellos que colaboraron con esta obra, porque no me quedan palabras para describir que esta obra es un gran exito. ¡GRACIAS!

23426089.review:
Antes que nada quiero dar las gracias al creador por dejarnos una obra tan hermosa e intensa gratuitamente, deberian cobrar por ella. Sin duda pagaría.

Para aquellos con dudas es un libro, con su exelente musica ambiental, unos pocos de efectos sonoros y bonitos dibujos, pero libro al fin y al cabo. No tomas decisiones, no interaccionas pero vale la pena meterle mano.

La historia al principio es sencilla, quiza un poco confusa a veces por algun que otro detalle pero sobre todo divertida por las ocurrencias y meteduras de pata del protagonista (una de ellas presente en el video de la tienda). Conforme avanzas te encuentras con pequeñas reflecciones filosoficas que bien pueden pillarte por sorpresa por que al fin y al cabo estas leyendo una historia sobre como un par de estudiantes la lian en su ultimo curso ¿no?, pues no,  no es esa la historia, hay mucho más de lo que al principio se ve y por ello recomiendo esta pequeña obra de arte.
Cuanto mas avanzas mas ves que algo no encaja, que no es lo que parece a simple vista lo que el escritor nos quiere decir y hasta que no llegas al final (el epilogo, no os salteis el epilogo!!) no terminas de entender la maravilla que acabas de leer. Todo el placer de leer este libro no es nada comprado a cuando lo terminas, refleccionas un poco (solo un poco, no hace falta darle muchas vueltas) sobre ese "detalle que no termina de encajar" y te das realmente cuenta de lo que acabas de leer y que a pesar de las pistas que ha ido dejando el autor no veias.

De nuevo GRACIAS al desarrollador por dejarnos disfrutar de esta joya sin pedir nada acambio a pesar de todo lo que vale.

"One Thousand Lies" Sin duda alguna es una gran Novela Visual que a pesar de contar con una minima cantidad de capitulos (5) sin contar el epilogo claro esta, llenan de total emocion a quien lee cada parrafo conforme va transcurriendo.

Seing these people with quite varying personalities is quite exciting, with Ciar and Luce being nearly similar, almost complementing one another in their escapades XD

With Ciar and Ausse, these two can seem to play along with each other quite a lot, but at other times seem to be clueless of the other's intentions and thought processes

As for Ciar and Claire, it's sort of like a kind of healing and understanding relationship.  You'd never expect these two to converse so smoothly, but it clearly shows the care of Claire selflessly helping and talking about deep things with Ciar, which is something which strongly helps him develop as a character

23220561.review:
One of the best (and longest) free VNs on Steam. 

Do pay attention while reading because the story gets convoluted and twisted until it affects the text's readability. 
It is deep and meaningful, only if you understand it, but part of making a good VN is allowing the reader to understand [i]everything[/i] in the story without excessive thinking no matter how 'deep' it goes. This game doesn't do a great job on this maybe because it is a translated one but I don't know. The game also switches in and out of the so-called 'serious' parts frequently, which is a jarring experience when the reader is already spending so much effort trying to fully absorb the story at its 'serious' parts. 

Art and soundtrack are top-notch considering that it is an indie game. The game is visually presented in a way that hooks you right in and keeps you playing, especially with the attractive cast with a good sense of humour. All the other reviews talk about this so I'm going to stop here lest I turn my review into an essay. ;) 

If you're not into this kind of anime styled character design, don't let it keep you from trying this VN out. Conversely, if you're expecting dating and/or hentai because of all the female characters, you are definitely wasting your time that is obviously better spent on Sakura Clicker and Nekopara lmao

Increíble
∞/10

One Thousand Lies es un juego hermoso desde mi punto de vista, me encantó cómo se desarrolla la historia, sus personajes tan característicos, la gran ambientación, la música y mucho más.

Dando un análisis objetivo sobre todo, comentaré lo siguiente:
Personajes: Se siente un gran desarrollo en ellos, cada uno es muy característico y muy humano, tienen sentimientos y hasta he logrado encariñarme con ellos.
Ambientación: La ambientación está muy bien conseguida, se dan los escenarios perfectos para cada ocasión y ni hablar de la banda sonora, que siempre cambia su tono según la situación, adaptando los momentos para mejorar la experiencia del momento.
Arte: Los Sprites están hechos de una manera magnifica, 10/10 mis respetos al artista que los ha dibujado y ni hablar de las ilustraciones para momentos característicos y únicos en la historia.
Feels: Sé que este no es un punto muy común en los análisis, pero lo he tenido que añadir porque lo que más me ha gustado de este juego son los sentimientos que este transmite, en ocasiones me ha dado mucha risa, en otras hasta casi lloro (Sí que lloré en el final) y en otras hasta me hacía reflexionar, tengo que afirmar que este juego ha tocado mi kokoro.
Historia: He dejado este punto para el final pero es porque es lo más importante, la Historia de este es tan buena que no puedo calificarla sólo con una nota, la forma en cómo se desarrollan los sucesos, los personajes, algunos giros en el argumento que nos encontramos y la capacidad con la que esta historia es capaz de hacer reír, llorar, poner feliz o hasta triste, por esto me parece que este juego es único.

En definitiva, mi nota es un ∞/10, siento que es un juego que todos deberían jugar y hasta yo que ya lo jugué, siento en mí la necesidad de volverlo a jugar, y sobre todo, recuerden... que Detrás de mil mentiras, hay una verdad oculta.

23126129.review:
I'm not entirely sure how to feel about this game.

It's free, so that changes a lot. Is it worth the money? Well duh. It's free.

So maybe a better question: Is it worth the time to play? Yes.

The dialogue initially rubbed me as a bit haughty, and forcibly complex. Almost like it was written for a Lit class where the goal was not to get your point across effectively, but to make it sound sophisticated and intellectual. Either this let up or I got used to it, because by the end of this story I felt like the dialogue was more natural and comprehensible. There were certainly a lot of powerful bits of dialogue, and a lot of trope-breakers for the VN genre, and that's easily the strongest point of the game to me. The game critiques its own genre well, while still using the genre's inherent benefits to its advantage.

The music is great. I loved Claire's "theme". Definitely going to be using it as my ringtone from now on.

I wasn't the biggest fan of the art. Be it the backgrounds or the character sprites. The backgrounds felt a little bit low-effort (A particular story element involving mirroring comes to mind), and I don't feel like there are quite enough character sprites to match the dialogue. General consensus is that the art is good though. Perhaps Grisaia just spoiled me.

The story is great. I thought to myself early on, "Oh, that's what 'One Thousand Lies' is referring to." And then I was wrong. And then I thought it again. And then I was wrong again. Repeat a few more times. I do love it when a story surprises me.

There's a good deal of fourth wall breaking and meta-dialogue going on. I loved the shoutouts and references. Katawa especially.

Let's talk about my big problem with the game.

SPOILERS AHEAD
-
-
-
-
-
-
-
-

I really felt like the whole premise of "the game doesn't necessarily tell you the truth" was a cop-out. A novel twist to be sure, but it destroys the impact of the story when I can't really even be sure of what parts of the story were true or not. I don't have a problem with unreliable narrators. But by the end of the story I feel like there were so many contradictions in the story that a single interpretation of the plot couldn't be discerned. Though people don't have to get the same lessons out of the story, I feel like they should at least have the same idea of the events that transpired. I started another playthrough, and was excited to see the references to Claire's... twist.... but there were so many direct contradictions that I started doubting that even that was true.

I rated this 8/10 on VNDB, and I'll stick with that here since there's no formal numerical rating. I give it an 8 despite my big problems with the plot, because there are a substantial number of powerful and pleasantly well-written bits of dialogue thrown throughout.

At any rate -- This is a fantastic first VN from Keinart Lobre, and I look forward to seeing what he has in store next.

23115683.review:
No tengo mucha costumbre de puntuar o dejar análisis sobre los juegos que voy terminando, pero la verdad es que esta historia (no olvidemos que es una novela kinética), merece que al menos le dedique unas palabras.

Como muchos de los que supongo que acabarán aquí por mis mismos motivos, encontré One Thousand Lies de rebote, expuesto como algo gratuito y atractivo. En un principio no tenía muy claro qué esperar, ni si iba a ser de estos juegos que instalas y desinstalas en el tiempo que tardas en acabarte un café. Pero, en vista de las 10 horas que me ha mantenido en vilo, no puedo tener para él malas palabras.

Es cierto que en momentos se vuelve demasiado prosaico, y que algunas de las reflexiones dan muchos círculos para acabar quedándote con la sensación de haber rascado sólo un poco la superficie del mensaje que querían transmitir, pero también es muy cierto que pese a que los primeros días de juego entraba por ir matando el tiempo, las últimas horas que le he dedicado (que bien podrían ser más de la mitad del juego) tenía ganas de continuar adelante, de saber cómo iba a continuar y sobretodo, de si el cierre de la historia estaría a la altura de mis expectativas.
Y vamos, ha cumplido muy de lejos. 

No quiero destripar nada de esta historia porque con toda sinceridad, merece ser leída. No va a ser un clásico que quede para la posteridad ni va a cambiar la forma de ver el mundo, pero si le podéis dedicar unas cuantas horas de vuestra vida, va a conseguir sacaros unas cuantas sonrisas y va a hacer que reflexionéis sobre las decisiones que tomamos en nuestro día a día.

Así que, no tengo mucho más que decir. Dadle una oportunidad.
Buen trabajo al equipo de Keinart Lobre, y espero seguir sabiendo de vosotros.

Un saludo.

Puntuación: 9/10

23021078.review:
Maravilloso

One Thousand Lies no podra ser el mejor de los juegos, pero si una historia hermosa. Pese a no poseer jugabilidad alguna la historia que nos relata, la forma en que se nos presenta, el desarrollo de los personajes lo hacen una obra destacable.

En un primer momento la historia parece ser una del monton, con un protagonista antipatico y desagradable y con secundarios que bien podrian ser terciarios. Por suerte esto solo dura unos minutos, tras los cuales descubrimos que si bien los personajes pueden llegar a ser predecibles no se volveran tediosos ni cargantes.

El desarrollo de estos a lo largo de la historia es lo que personalmente mas destaco, puesto que algunos llegan a dar un giro de 180° respecto al como fueron presentados y, ademas, presentan un trasfondo mucho mas complejo de lo que inicialmente uno como lector (porque uno es mas lector que jugador en esta obra) se plantea.

Realmente recomiendo esta novela visual.

23016476.review:
Este juego nos cuenta la historia de un alumno de 2º de bachillerato, que después de pedir una figurita por internet. Al ver que en vez de llegarle su figurita le llega un extraño correo electrónico, decide investigar de donde procede dicha carta.
Una visual-novel bastante interesante y entretenida.
La banda sonora es una delicia al igual que algunos sprites.

23010029.review:
I guess I'm just not one for visual novels. I was expecting some sort of actual decision making type game play and all I got was a lot of reading.
Now, don't get me wrong, I love to read. I'm a super book nerd. But this just wasn't cutting it for me.
While I'm sure it's a very intriguing story, the writing style didn't suit me and the jumping around between different story lines with no clear transition or explanation was dizzying. 
Again, that's just my personal opinion. Other people seem to really enjoy it and that's great. Just not for me.

22992523.review:
Hola, me quiero dar el tiempo de dar una reseña, cosa que nunca hago porque no veo necesidad. Pero siendo yo una persona que no le gusta jugar este tipo de juegos (que tienes que leer mucho), y que a podido experimentar cosas que no esperaba encontrar en este tipo de juegos, describir dos cosas por las que vale la pena jugarlo:

22979550.review:
[h1]천개의 거짓말[/h1]

무료 미연시게임이다.
영문 게임이다보니 내용을 제대로 알수는 없고,
도전과제용으로 하면 좋은 게임이다.
메인스토리를 할때 텍스트를 빠르게 클릭해서 넘어간다고해도 최소 1시간의 플레이타임이 걸린다.
도전과제를 완료하기 위해서는 메인스토리와는 별개로 'One Thousand Lies'라는 제목 바로 아래
'One Hidden Truth'을 클릭하면 장면이 몇개 나오고 계속 클릭하다보면 도전과제가 자연히 완료된다.
도전과제 1개 추가용으로 하기에 좋은 게임.
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=684189263
게임이 영문이라 내용을 알수 없다는게 심히 아쉽다.
제작자 입장에선 나름대로 심혈을 기울려서 만든 게임일텐데...

평점 80점.

22971472.review:
First, let me say I finished the entire story and it's beautifully writen. I did spot a few typos but that's not even something to complain about. It's a beautiful story with beautiful artwork and incredible characters. This was my first visual novel that I've ever read and I will never forget this novel. The characters in this story are very relateable and captivating and made me want more of the story with every line they spoke. The music was always perfect with the talks they had amungst themselves too! It's just an all around great story. Honestly, words cannot discribe how fantastic this story is. I guess you will have to read it for yourself.

Thank you. <3

P.S. I would love to see this become an Anime.

22966241.review:
Bueno, acabo de finalizar tanto la historia como epílogo (logro que acredita lo que digo), y así en caliente me apetece dar un poco por encima mi opinión.

Me ha encantado. Bien, una vez dicho esto, voy a extenderme un poquito más. Son casi las tres de la madrugada, no es una hora que invite mucho a alargarse demasiado escribiendo, pero allá vamos:

Nos encontramos aquí ante una novela visual que bien podríamos considerar como un libro. Y digo esto, porque no hay decisiones que tomar, solo seguir la historia que se nos presenta. Y bueno, tengo que decir que si bien empecé este... no se si llamarlo juego por su carácter meramente literario, pero lo voy a hacer; este juego lo inicie basicamente por dos motivos: el primero, es que gratuito y el segundo, que tiene logros (más concretamente 1).

Una vez completado, me arrepiento un poco de mis motivaciones iniciales. Si, la estetica así en plan anime me llamo la atención, nunca había jugado una novela visual y bueno no ha sido para nada una mala experiencia. La historia me ha parecido muy completa, con sus toques de humor y momentos más tensos. Como olvidar ese momento patriotico-americano, la partida de "póquer" o las apariciones del "calvo cabrón" xD Si bien la historia creo que ha ido de menos a más, con una introducción al principio un tanto confusa, tengo que decir que me ha ido enganchando al punto que en el capitulo 3 aproximadamente cada dialogo que pasaba me sentía como "oh dios, que bueno se está poniendo todo, no quiero que se acabe nunca D:" y ese sentimiento se ha ido prolongando hasta el final. La historia tiene giros muy interesantes, y transfondos morales que la hacen muy interesante.

Sinceramente, recomiendo a todo el mundo que le de una oportunidad. Y por supuesto, le doy las gracias al creador Keinart por tan excelente trabajo, al tiempo que le animo a que siga creando. Aunque es un juego gratuito, creo que puedo decir sin ninguna duda que habría pagado por One Thousand Lies gustosamente. :)

Nota: 9'3/10

22927751.review: One Thousand Lies is a very well written knetic novel with a nice blend of comedy and romance while not over saturating the story with either. This is a great take on the Greek story of Pygmalion that is updated to the modern world with a few pop culture reference sprinkled throughout the story. The puns and references within the story flowed nicely together and didn't feel forced with a few taking me by suprise. Overall this was one best VNs I have read in while and with it being free, the only thing you'll spend on it is your time.

22922321.review: Such an astounding story. It had the works, twists and turns, romance, etc. It had me in tears at the end, please read this.

22920207.review: Impressive work. And amazing it is free, it is an amazing story!

22905374.review:
Maravilloso

One Thousand Lies no podra ser el mejor de los juegos, pero si una historia hermosa. Pese a no poseer jugabilidad alguna la historia que nos relata, la forma en que se nos presenta y el desarrollo de los personajes lo hacen una obra destacable.

En un primer momento la historia parece ser una del monton, con un protagonista antipatico y desagradable y con secundarios que bien podrian ser terciarios. Por suerte esto solo dura unos minutos, tras los cuales descubrimos que si bien los personajes pueden llegar a ser predecibles no se volveran tediosos ni cargantes.

El desarrollo de estos a lo largo de la historia es lo que personalmente mas destacó, puesto que algunos llegan a dar un giro de 180° respecto al como fueron presentados y, además, presentan un trasfondo mucho mas complejo de lo que inicialmente uno como lector (porque uno es mas lector que jugador en esta obra) se plantea.

Realmente recomiendo esta novela visual.

Pd: Me borraría la memoria para jugar otra vez

I enjoyed this visual novel and i could definitely say,that this is one of THE BEST visual novels that i ever read, not only because of the art style, but because of the story and the soundtrack. This story is not only fun  but it even teaches you one thing

that in the thousand of lies, there is always one hidden truth

Simply amazing. It was my first visual novel, and I don't yet know if there will be some better ones than One Thousand Lies, but I must say that, even though the developer was a "novice" and the few resources that he/she may have had, I've enjoyed it so much.
The complexity and originality of the plot is great, and even though I'm Spanish and I read it in English (it's available in Spanish, but I read it in English so it helps me with my English tests), I was able to understand it.

22871863.review: Beautiful soundtrack, amazing art, and a story that will leave you asking for more.............

22867902.review:
Empiezo diciendo que One Thousand Lies es una novela visual (a partir de ahora la llamaré NV) kinética, esto es, no hay decisiones que tomar en la historia, y lo único que se requiere del lector es seguir activando la tecla que avance el texto, o dicho en otras palabras, estamos ante la forma más básica de NV: una historia con el añadido de imágenes. Lo cierto es que la historia me ha encantado y los personajes estaban muy bien dibujados. Eso es lo único que busco en una NV. A eso le añadimos el hecho de que es gratuito.

Todos los personajes tienen una personalidad que los hace únicos y memorables, con un carisma que no había visto desde hace mucho tiempo. La historia se va desarrollando a lo largo de 5 capítulos, cada uno añadiendo una dosis aún mayor de incógnitas que el anterior,... hasta la revelación final, que es simplemente sorprendente.

No engaño a nadie diciendo que me he sentido preocupado por los personajes, y por el desenlace de la historia en general. Tiene unos puntos cómicos por momentos, y podríamos decir que la historia se va desarrollando en torno a al romance, pero también entra en cuestiones filosóficas y psicológicas muy interesantes de forma bastante intensa, por las que he llegado a sentir curiosidad, confusión y, en último término, satisfacción.

No puedo decir mucho más porque destripar la historia sería pecado, así que lo dejaré como lectura recomendada para todo aquel que guste de leer NV. Tiene una duración corta para ser una novela, lo cual puede ser un aliciente para introducirse en las NV si eres nuevo. ¿He dicho que es gratis? Me da vergüenza disponer de una NV con la que he disfrutado tanto y no haber dado nada a cambio. Muchas otras NV de pago languidecen en comparación.

En conlusión, leedlo. Seguro que os sorprende. Para bien, espero.

22867482.review:
Primero de todo, no os esperéis ningún tipo de decisión ni nada por el estilo. Más que un juego es una novela visual. Aclarado esto, empecemos:

Pese a no ser un juego, debo decir que me ha encantado y que me lo he terminado en literalmente dos tardes. Lo recomiendo muchísimo, tanto por la trama; los escenarios; la banda sonora; por los diálogos, aunque hay veces que hasta son confusos, cuando tocan ser serios lo son y cuando son divertidos son muy buenos; también por los personajes, que no son muchos pero les coges cariño fácilmente. No quiero deciros nada pero dadle una oportunidad, dejad que trascurra la historia y lo más probable es que no os arrepintáis.

Dicho esto, si no buscáis un juego sino una bonita historia con tintes de humor, romance, misterio y mentiras (mil para ser exactos XD), yo os la recomiendo. Sin saber cómo, las horas leyendo pasan como si fuesen nada.
 
Desde mi subjetividad: 10/10

22864601.review:
One Thousand Lies is probably the best Visual Novel I have read. Now i know that technically it is a Kinetic Novel, seeing as there are no choices, but honestly in this story no choices is probably the best option.

Pros:
+Good Variety of characters and personality
+FANTASTIC Soundtrack (Seriously, it's free with the game so you have no excuse)
+Intresting Story
+Good Art
+The One Hidden Truth Ending is really good at tying up loose ends.
+IT IS FREE.

Neutral Points:
=The filler plot is just that, filler. Some like it, some don't.
=The stock images in the background are good and blend in with the rest of the game, but isn't spectacular.
=The plot, as in-depth as it is, may be confusing to some.

Negatives:
-Would like some more save slots
-[spoiler]WHY LUCY AND NOT CLAIRE?[/spoiler]
-There isn't more.
-Some of the speech really is pointless, and doesn't add to character and world building. But not much.
-Ciaran is kinda a dick at the end.

Overall, I would highly reccomend OTL, AND I WILL RE-ITERATE IT IS FREE FOR GODS SAKE GET IT NOW!
Great if you want to read a good story. Because it is very good. I would rate this game a 9 1/2 / 10, due to it's complex storyline, good art and interesting characters.
Also make sure to read the One Hidden Truth by clicking on the title at the main menu.

As a Final note, I would like to thank the developer(s) of OTL, For an amazing experience and a great read.

22850792.review:
Free kinetic novel that tells a story of struggle

First off, the game is a kinetic novel (KN). That means unlike Visual Novels (VNs), there are no choices to choose and the sotry is already pretty much set out for you. If no input at all doesn't float your boat, I wouldn't recommend this game.

That being said, the KN is a story about our protagonist Ciar who is enjoying his life at school. Along to have shits and giggles with him are his two buddies Aussie and Zina. The writer creates hilarious scenarios with references to games and social aspects dotting the game.

[spoiler] However, underneath all theses happy moments are some serious issues. Our main protagonist is more than an average student. The others he meet are also hiding things. Play it throught to figure out. [/spoiler]

The game is a roughly 4 - 6 hour playthrough. Although that depends more on your reading speed and whether you skip certain dialouge or not.

Great music and great art.

I had a blast reading the story. Kudos to the creator!

22818562.review:
It's free, so you might as well check it out. 

As other people have pointed it, the music and soundtrack is pretty solid, and characterization is also good. The dialogue and general writing is well-written and at times hilarious. At the very least, you should get a lot of laughs from this.

HOWEVER I feel like this VN tries and ultimately fails to deliver whatever its intended message is. Each character, at one point or another, breaks into a long monologue built on abstraction and vague metaphor. The story is also occassionally non-linear (and not in a good or effective way), the protagonist is likely to grate on your nerves, and whatever the theme is (something, of course, about lies, but how the worst liar is also the most free or powerful or true person? There's a lot of angst about society and conformity - that the VN fails to cohesively tell what it's "really about" after playing through should be a testament to its ineffectiveness) ultimately fell flat or went over my head.

Overall: I'm glad to have played it - it was funny, entertaining, and even if I didn't understand all of it, it was worth it. What I WON'T do is play through it again to see if I've missed anything in terms of the message, or try and see if it makes more sense the second time. I don't like VNs, or for that matter, any media that tries to preach a message to me. 

Check it out, and see what you think. It's kind of a mixed bag, but worth at least looking at.

Intentare ser breve, pero no se si pueda debido a la cantidad de puntos de los que me gustaria hablar.
[h1]Es una maravilla[/h1]

[b]One thousand Lies[/b] no es un juego, [u]es una historia[/u], una contada desde el autor hacia el jugador. Una historia camuflada por capas y capas de contenido. [i]¿Saben cual es la diferencia entre una historia de calidad y una simplona?...[/i] que la historia simplona quiere hablar de mucho sin saber de nada, mientras la otra habla de poco y te demuestra lo mucho que es.

[b]One Thousand Lies[/b] es una leccion, de filosofia, de psicologia, y de vida cotidiana. Y oculta todo eso tras una historia en segundo plano que a su vez es ocultada por un personaje que hace de protagonista.

Es [u]por mucho[/u] la mejor historia en una novela visual que he jugado.
Llegue a conocerla por pura casualidad y calo profundo dentro de mi propio ser.

22771245.review:
I've already reviewed this, but I'm updating it because I'm in the process of replaying it and have had some new thoughts on it.

It's (still) got a good soundtrack


That's pretty much the only definitive thing I can say about this game. It's just hard to describe. It's really complex, there are a lot of twists and false truths. Everything comes through in the end I guess. It can be really funny at some points, even towards the end where the seriousness becomes much more prevalent and the game approaches its terminal stage. Overall, I liked the story. Aside from some confusing moments, it touched on some interesting points. The store page is more or less competely honest in it's description of the characters and content (Super relatable protagonist btw. You can decide whether or not that's sarcasm. It probably says something about me). However, most (all) of the characters have much more to their background than it seems at first glance. The story gets really philosphical at moments, which sometimes felt out of place given that the cast are all high school seniors (I personally have yet to meet high schoolers so thoughtful).

As I play it yet another time, two years later, I find myself enjoying it just as much as I did the first time. The writing is still really funny, sometimes in a stupid, immature high schooler kind of way, and other times in a much more interesting manner. I might even be enjoying it even more than the first time. I find myself finding all these little hints and lines which I didn't notice the first time, which has really given me an even better appreciation for the writing. Much like rereading a book and finding deeper meanings, or simply understanding the story better. It makes sense I suppose, as this is ultimately a story, albeit one with pictures.

I've not played many other Visual Novel games (just one in fact, Trick or Treat, which is notable here only because it too was made by Spaniards) so I can't say for sure how it compares. The story is thoughtful and deep, the art style seems on par with the best, and it very clearly avoids most of the cliches and sterotypes that other VN games seem to have on Steam. You know the ones. The Sakura-type games. The kind where you generally check out the page as a sort of joke, and if you purchase it, you find yourself breaking out into embarassed laughter at the sheer absurdity and cringiness of the story. By comparison, when I laughed while playing One Thousand Lies, it was often becauase I genuinely found the writing funny. None of the characters are particularly shallow or transparent, and they all had quirks and unique personalities (you know, like real people).

Most importantly, it's free, so just download it and decide whether or not you like it for yourself. You're better suited for making those decisions, and what do you have to lose besides your time? Can't be that valuable. You play video games on Steam.

It's also the 1 school shooting simulator 2k15-2k17

22732470.review:
As a visual novel, [i] One Thousand Lies [/i] is exceptionally well made, especially considering that it's available as a free-to-play title. The art is top notch; the character sprites were lively and allowed me to connect with the characters; the characters themselves were attractive (physically and spiritually) and realistic, relatable enough but not overly so; the soundtrack had good variety and didn't get repetitive or annoying; the writing is skillful and eloquent, with almost no grammatical errors.

[b] But as a game, as an experience, as a piece of artistic creation: this VN bored me, made me angry, and worst of all it left me with a feeling of disappointment. [/b]

The story was far longer than it needed to be, due to heaps of filler content. For the most part, said content can be sorted into two categories: anecdotes/fan service side stories that are meant to be funny or help readers connect with the characters but almost always end up being too tedious and dramatic; and condescending, holier-than-thou philosophical rants about how humans lie, why humans lie, and the paradoxical consequences of lying. 

As far as the former goes, I'll give an example straight from the game: [spoiler] "From the hallway, I can still hear what's happening on the other side of the door. I can hear the woman I love declaring her love for another man ... My heart is broken, leaving me feeling empty inside. How foolish. I'm no more than a feeble cuckold, resigned to never leave his nest. My soul is sinking further into the drain of desperation while the world keeps spinning. I'm unable to bear the sound of everyone else's happiness. My sanity is blinded by jealousy, which in turn causes me to retreat into loneliness." [/spoiler] That was but a small excerpt of the protagonist's self-narration of a prank he and his friends play on the substitute teachers. It's actually a very complicated prank, involving a love rectangle, and I've only quoted the tip of the iceberg. Pranks such as this one, and painfully detailed descriptions of every time any of the six main characters interact with each other in any way, make up the bulk of the writing in this VN.

Interlaced through all that verbal diarrhea (if I may borrow the term from critics of Stephen King) are repetitive, robotic monologues about lying and deception, which if you haven't gathered already is the central theme of the game. There's nothing inherently wrong with monologuing, so long as it's used sparingly to cause dramatic effect and prove a point (like exclamation marks). In this VN, literally all six main characters go on rants at least once throughout the game, and the lovely protagonist will make you sit through two to six of them in EACH CHAPTER. The worst part, though, is that they're all talking about the same things, time after time, one character after another. It's like a character will be doing whatever, being themselves, and then break away from their own personality to talk about something that the game developer thought was important. It completely broke the immersion for me, and made it difficult for me to see each character as their own person and thus relate to them or even like them. Rather it seemed to me they were all used as tools, as symbols or personifications of morals and greater philosophical truths. All characters were defined, first and foremost, by their common flaw: that they, like all humans, lie.

Not only were the monologues repetitive, they were always degrading. In most cases, when a character admits to a flaw of theirs, they do so by opening up, coming out of their shell. They naturally would feel insecure and would speak in an unconfident, gentle, vulnerable tone. Not in this VN! Every character, regardless of their personality, becomes a narcissistic, lecturing asshole when they go into monologue. [u]Have you ever known someone that tries too hard to be "smart"? They'll use big, fancy words to say simple things, and use philosophy to sound wiser than everyone else? And you can't stand having a conversation with them because they can't stop pointing out flaws in your opinions? That is how this ENTIRE GAME made me feel.[/u]

[b] Now, I am NOT saying that there was nothing good about this game.[/b] I fully admit that each character has their own unique traits, and more than half of them grew on me. But because they were all defined by their common problem with lying, they never fully developed or individualized. The protagonist does "overcome" his problem in a hasty, unrefined epilogue (following a confusing ending which offers no resolution), as does his primary love interest (out of necessity, in order to complement him), but none of the other characters do. There's no story apart from interactions between characters, because the primary focus of the plot is to preach a greater truth.

As a game, [i] One Thousand Lies [/i] was
NOT FUN,
NOT SATISFYING, 
NOT THOUGHT-PROVOKING,
And therefore
NOT RECOMMENDED.
